589.flavor: No matter how lightly you tread, how soft your step, he will hear you. He will find you.

590.name: Bruxa
590.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2).
590.ability_html: Thrive. Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2).
590.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
590.flavor: The vampiress lunged in a blur, unleashing an inhuman shriek. The wall of sound slammed into the witcher like a battering ram – splintering his ribs, forcing the air from his lungs, and sending tendrils of pain down his spine.

591.name: Vivienne de Tabris
591.ability: Deploy: Set a unit's power equal to its provision cost.
591.ability_html: Deploy: Set a unit's power equal to its provision cost.
591.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
591.flavor: Vivienne's a bit of an odd duck for a lady-in-waitin'. But by the Gods, ye can't deny her beauty an' grace!

592.name: Damien de la Tour
592.ability_html: Order (Melee): Reset your leader ability.
592.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
592.flavor: I served Beauclair well. At least... I hope I did.

593.name: Palmerin de Launfal
593.ability: Deploy: Choose an unboosted enemy unit, then play the top card from your deck and boost that unit by that card's provision cost. If you control Milton de Peyrac-Peyran, you may choose from the top 3 cards of your deck instead.
593.ability_html: Deploy: Choose an unboosted enemy unit, then play the top card from your deck and boost that unit by that card's provision cost. If you control Milton de Peyrac-Peyran, you may choose from the top 3 cards of your deck instead.
593.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
593.flavor: Rumor had it the esteemed baron Palmerin de Launfal had fallen into a profane affair with a succubus. The duchess, however, gave no credence to such baseless hearsay.

594.name: Milton de Peyrac-Peyran
594.ability:
Deploy: Boost an enemy unit by 3, then boost self by 3.
Order: Boost self by the last boost you gave to an enemy unit this round.
594.ability_html: Deploy: Boost an enemy unit by 3, then boost self by 3. Order: Boost self by the last boost you gave to an enemy unit this round.
594.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
594.flavor: Glinting under the rays of the Beauclair sun, there was no mistaking this knight-errant who bore the head of a great, white bull on his shield.

595.name: Artorius Vigo
595.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy: Create and play a 1-power copy of a bronze unit from your starting deck.
595.ability_html: Assimilate. Deploy: Create and play a 1-power copy of a bronze unit from your starting deck.
595.keyword_html: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
595.flavor: It is said he created an illusion so realistic that he began to believe it himself...

596.name: Roderick of Dun Tynne
596.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play 1 of them.
596.ability_html: Disloyal. Deploy: Look at 2 random gold cards from your deck, then play 1 of them.
596.keyword_html: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
596.flavor: Roderick lived as a recluse, avoiding society at large. Instead, he preferred the company of a small party of knights. If they can truly be called such...

597.name: Tourney Shaelmaar
597.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy Nilfgaard unit by 7.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by 2 for each non-Neutral allied unit from a different faction than your starting one.
597.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy Nilfgaard unit by 7. Deploy (Ranged): Boost self by 2 for each non-Neutral allied unit from a different faction than your starting one.
597.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
597.flavor: Releasing a monster that dangerous in front of a crowd? Plain irresponsible.

598.name: Tourney Joust
598.ability: Remove an enemy unit's Shield and damage it by 4, or give an allied unit a Shield and boost it by 4.
598.ability_html: Remove an enemy unit's Shield and damage it by 4, or give an allied unit a Shield and boost it by 4.
598.keyword_html: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
598.flavor: Fame and glory eternal await the victor of this year's annual chivalric tourney!

599.name: Toussaintois Knight-Errant
599.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If it has at least 6 power, damage by 4 instead.
599.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If it has at least 6 power, damage by 4 instead.
599.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
599.flavor: White steed, shiny-arse armor... Aye, 'tis a knight-errant alright. Fetch the coffin maker!

600.name: Ducal Guard
600.ability:
Flanking.
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you used your leader ability this turn.
600.ability_html: Flanking. At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you used your leader ability this turn.
600.keyword_html: Flanking: If this unit is adjacent to only one card: on your Melee row, its end of turn ability is triggered twice; on your Ranged row, gain 1 Armor at the end of your turn.
600.flavor: And whatever you do, never, EVER, mention the duchess's sister. Right, so... Welcome to Her Majesty's royal guard!

601.name: Menagerie Keeper
601.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If you have a Tactic in your hand, also give it Bleeding (2).
601.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If you have a Tactic in your hand, also give it Bleeding (2).
601.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
601.flavor: If there's one thing Nilfgaardians love more than blood-soaked arena battles, it's blood-soaked arena battles with exotic beasts.

602.name: Imperial Diviner
602.ability_html: Assimilate. Deploy: Purify a unit.
602.keyword_html: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses.
602.flavor: Emperor Emhyr var Emreis spared no effort to find his daughter, even resorting to arcane magics of the mages and sorceresses he had so vehemently despised.

603.name: Fangs of the Empire
603.ability_html: Deploy: Poison an enemy unit.
603.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
603.flavor: For a courtesan, a single drop. For a rock troll, an entire bottle. And for Nordling scum? Why waste good poison when a rusty dagger will do?

604.name: Duchess' Informant
604.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a non-Disloyal bronze enemy unit.
604.ability_html: Disloyal. Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a non-Disloyal bronze enemy unit.
604.keyword_html: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
604.flavor: Anna Henrietta wakes every morn to the tune of her songbirds.

605.name: King Roegner
605.ability: Deploy (Melee): Remove Shield from all units, then boost self by 3 for each Shield removed.
605.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Remove Shield from all units, then boost self by 3 for each Shield removed.
605.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
605.flavor: King Roegner of Cintra, once grievously wounded at the bottom of a ravine, hollered for aid. Alas... His call was answered only by the hisses of vipers and the howls of ravenous werewolves...

606.name: Queen Adalia
606.ability: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze non-Neutral unit from your hand, then give it a Shield.
606.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze non-Neutral unit from your hand, then give it a Shield.
606.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
606.flavor: Queen Adalia of Cintra possessed the power to raise a drawbridge with a twitch of her brow. A frightening thought what she could do with a wave of her hand...

607.name: Prince Anséis
607.ability:
Formation.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Inspired: Duel an enemy unit instead.
607.ability_html: Formation. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 4. Inspired: Duel an enemy unit instead.
607.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Duel: Units take turns dealing damage equal to their power until one of them is destroyed.
607.flavor: Your presence at this tourney is an affront to my honor!

608.name: Vissegerd
608.ability:
Deploy: Gain Charges equal to the number of boosted allied units.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Charge: 1
608.ability_html: Deploy: Gain Charges equal to the number of boosted allied units. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Charge: 1
608.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
608.flavor: I will raise Cintra from the ashes no matter how great the cost.

609.name: Coodcoodak
609.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Purify adjacent units.
609.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Purify: Remove all statuses.
609.flavor: Coodcoodak, throwing his head back, howled and growled, screeched and squealed, whined and bleated – all in a medley of voices both known and unknown, domestic and wild, of reality and of myth.

610.name: Windhalm of Attre
610.ability:
Shield
At the end of your turn, if this unit has Shield, boost it by 2.
Order (Grace 10): Gain a Shield.
610.ability_html: Shield At the end of your turn, if this unit has Shield, boost it by 2. Order (Grace 10): Gain a Shield.
610.keyword_html: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Grace: The first time this unit's power is equal to or higher than the specified amount, trigger the ability. If the condition is already met when it enters the battlefield, trigger it immediately.
610.flavor: Off with his head! But slowly, drag it out, put on a show for all to see. His death must serve as an example.

611.name: Runeword
611.ability: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms Mage and give it a Shield.
611.ability_html: Create and play a bronze Northern Realms Mage and give it a Shield.
611.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
611.flavor: Probably best not to utter that.

612.name: Cintrian Spellweaver
612.ability:
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Charge: 1
Whenever you play a Mage or a Spell, gain 1 Charge.
612.ability_html: Order: Damage a unit by 1. Charge: 1 Whenever you play a Mage or a Spell, gain 1 Charge.
612.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.

613.name: Cintrian Enchantress
613.ability:
Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (2). 
Bonded: Give it Vitality (4) instead.
613.ability_html: Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (2). Bonded: Give it Vitality (4) instead.
613.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
613.flavor: The ladies of the Cintrian court are oft touted for their stately elegance – and equally impressive aptitude for magic

614.name: Cintrian Artificer
614.ability:
Formation.
Order: Give an allied unit a Shield.
614.ability_html: Formation. Order: Give an allied unit a Shield.
614.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
614.flavor: What shall I call it? Perhaps Andúril...

615.name: Cintrian Knight
615.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2.
Deathblow: Gain Vitality (2).
Grace 6: Boost self by 2.
615.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy by 2. Deathblow: Gain Vitality (2). Grace 6: Boost self by 2.
615.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding. Grace: The first time this unit's power is equal to or higher than the specified amount, trigger the ability. If the condition is already met when it enters the battlefield, trigger it immediately.
615.flavor: For whom does the bell toll?

616.name: Cintrian Royal Guard
616.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 3 for each allied Cintrian Royal Guard.
616.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 3 for each allied Cintrian Royal Guard.
616.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
616.flavor: Queen Calanthe handpicked her personal guard with meticulous care. Each must serve with unconditional loyalty, stand more than six feet tall, and possess a devilishly handsome jawline.

617.name: Cintrian Envoy
617.ability:
Formation.
Order: Look at 3 random cards from your deck. You may move 1 to the top of it.
Cooldown: 2
617.ability_html: Formation. Order: Look at 3 random cards from your deck. You may move 1 to the top of it. Cooldown: 2
617.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
617.flavor: She thought service in the diplomatic corps would mean a quiet life behind a desk. She and her blistered feet were sorely mistaken...

618.name: Knighthood
618.ability: Play a Knight from your deck and boost it by 1 for each Knight you control.
618.ability_html: Play a Knight from your deck and boost it by 1 for each Knight you control.
618.flavor: Kneel an everyman, arise a knight!

619.name: Fauve
619.ability: Deploy: Play a Nature card from your deck.
619.ability_html: Deploy: Play a Nature card from your deck.
619.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
619.flavor: At the edge of the wood, a lone dryad awaited them. Dandelion recognized her at once – the very same with green hair who had given them light in dark of night and urged the bard to continue his ballads.

620.name: The Great Oak
620.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by the number of cards to the left of Great Oak, then boost self by the number of cards to the right of Great Oak.
620.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by the number of cards to the left of Great Oak, then boost self by the number of cards to the right of Great Oak.
620.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
620.flavor: The trees of Brokilon oft rustle amongst themselves, despairing of the ancient oak whose heart now rots with hatred.

621.name: Weeping Willow
621.ability:
Harmony.
Order (Melee): Boost self by the number of unique primary categories among units you control.
Deploy (Ranged): Poison an enemy unit.
621.ability_html: Harmony. Order (Melee): Boost self by the number of unique primary categories among units you control. Deploy (Ranged): Poison an enemy unit.
621.keyword_html: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
621.flavor: Its name misleads, for 'tis not the tree who weeps.

622.name: Water of Brokilon
622.ability: Spawn 2 Dryad Fledglings on an allied row.
622.ability_html: Spawn 2 Dryad Fledglings on an allied row.
622.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
622.flavor: Drink, child. Wash away your past, your worries. Drink and become our sister!

623.name: Sirssa
623.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2 then boost a random unit in your hand by 2.
Deathblow: Boost a unit in your hand instead.
623.ability_html: Harmony. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2 then boost a random unit in your hand by 2. Deathblow: Boost a unit in your hand instead.
623.keyword_html: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
623.flavor: With silent grace, a dark-haired dryad nimbly descended a spiralling cascade of mushrooms along the tree's trunk, her lithe body camouflaged with fallen leaves.

624.name: Treant Boar
624.ability:
Deploy: If you control a Dryad, gain Zeal.
Order (Melee): Move self to the Ranged row, then Heal self.
Order (Ranged): Move self to the Melee row, then damage an enemy unit by 2.
Cooldown: 1
624.ability_html: Deploy: If you control a Dryad, gain Zeal. Order (Melee): Move self to the Ranged row, then Heal self. Order (Ranged): Move self to the Melee row, then damage an enemy unit by 2. Cooldown: 1
624.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
624.flavor: Dryads wield a mystifying power to shape the forest's trees into any form they wish. So why not a giant boar?

625.name: Dryad's Caress
625.ability: Purify an allied unit and boost it by 3. If you control a Dryad, also give it Vitality (3).
625.ability_html: Purify an allied unit and boost it by 3. If you control a Dryad, also give it Vitality (3).
625.keyword_html: Purify: Remove all statuses. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
625.flavor: Shh, shh... Evelienn va maeth, elaine blath...

626.name: Dryad Grovekeeper
626.ability:
Deploy: Gain Vitality (2).
Bonded: Gain Vitality (4) instead.
626.ability_html: Deploy: Gain Vitality (2). Bonded: Gain Vitality (4) instead.
626.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
626.flavor: Is it true? That flowers in Brokilon bloom seven times a year? But... How can that be?

627.name: Treant Mantis: Stalk
627.ability:
Ambush: When your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, Poison it and transform self into Treant Mantis: Strike.
Spring: Transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.
627.ability_html: Ambush: When your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, Poison it and transform self into Treant Mantis: Strike. Spring: Transform into Treant Mantis: Strike.
627.keyword_html: Ambush: Played face down, then flips over when the ability's condition is met. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Spring: Manual activation of a face-down Trap. Spring is activated automatically on a Trap played next to an Artifact. Cards with Spring are flipped over after use.
627.flavor: Feel to you like we're bein' followed?

628.name: Forest Whisperer
628.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Poison an enemy unit.
Order (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (3).
628.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Poison an enemy unit. Order (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (3).
628.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
628.flavor: The dryads of Brokilon mastered a unique craft – to shape trees at will... And breathe into them life.

629.name: Brokilon Sentinel
629.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Also Summon all copies of self from your deck to this row.
629.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Also Summon all copies of self from your deck to this row.
629.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
629.flavor: Brokilon is not merely the forest you see before you. She yet lives on in the cities, villages, and fields you so callously carved from her flesh. We shall yet reclaim what you have stolen from her.

630.name: Dryad Ranger
630.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deploy (Ranged): Poison an enemy unit.
630.ability_html: Harmony. Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deploy (Ranged): Poison an enemy unit.
630.keyword_html: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
630.flavor: I do not live in the forest of Brokilon. I am a part of it.

631.name: Dryad Matron
631.ability: At the end of your turn, move self to the rightmost position on this row, then boost the unit to the left by 1.
631.ability_html: At the end of your turn, move self to the rightmost position on this row, then boost the unit to the left by 1.
631.flavor: She teaches young dryads many useful skills: fletching arrows, communing with the forest, slitting the throats of men...

632.name: Dryad Fledgling
632.keyword_html: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units.
632.flavor: Having recently tasted of the Water of Brokilon, she yet feels strange in her new skin... Her gift for killing, on the other hand, bloomed without delay.

633.name: Knut the Callous
633.ability:
Zeal. Order: Damage an allied unit by half of its current power, then damage an enemy unit by the same amount.
Berserk 5: At the end of your turn, refresh this ability.
633.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Damage an allied unit by half of its current power, then damage an enemy unit by the same amount. Berserk 5: At the end of your turn, refresh this ability.
633.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
633.flavor: Knut, son of Oluf? Aye, never has a jarl's moniker fit so well.

634.name: Svalblod Totem
634.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn a Svalblod Fanatic on each side of this card. 
Order: Damage an allied unit by 2.
Cooldown: 1
634.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn a Svalblod Fanatic on each side of this card. Order: Damage an allied unit by 2. Cooldown: 1
634.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
634.flavor: All totems to Svalblod were ordered destroyed, yet on distant, forgotten shores some yet stand tall... And continue to collect new victims.

635.name: Artis
635.ability:
Deploy: Play a 4-provision Cultist from your deck.
Ranged: Whenever a unit is played, damage it by half its power.
635.ability_html: Deploy: Play a 4-provision Cultist from your deck. Ranged: Whenever a unit is played, damage it by half its power.
635.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
635.flavor: Not all Svalblod priests were forced from the isles... Unfortunately.

636.name: Vildkaarl
636.ability: Berserk 2: Transform into Champion of Svalblod.
636.ability_html: Berserk 2: Transform into Champion of Svalblod.
636.keyword_html: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
636.flavor: Strike me! C'mon, harder! You call this pain?!

637.name: Arnvald
637.ability: Deploy: Transform a damaged allied unit into a Bear Abomination.
637.ability_html: Deploy: Transform a damaged allied unit into a Bear Abomination.
637.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
637.flavor: His name on the island was synonymous with loyalty. For a time.

638.name: Sigvald
638.ability:
Whenever this unit is damaged by other non-status abilities, gain Bleeding for the same duration instead.
Order: Damage a unit by the duration of Bleeding on self, then Purify self. If it was an enemy unit, damage self by that amount. If it was an allied unit, boost self by that amount.
638.ability_html: Whenever this unit is damaged by other non-status abilities, gain Bleeding for the same duration instead. Order: Damage a unit by the duration of Bleeding on self, then Purify self. If it was an enemy unit, damage self by that amount. If it was an allied unit, boost self by that amount.
638.keyword_html: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Purify: Remove all statuses.
638.flavor: A vildkaarl that lives to old age earns the respect of his clan.

639.name: Corrupted Flaminica
639.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 2 for each unique Beast in your graveyard.
639.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 2 for each unique Beast in your graveyard.
639.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
639.flavor: At times, even druids succumb to Svalblod's whispers...

640.name: Svalblod Priest
640.ability: At the end of your turn, damage the unit to the right by 1, then boost self by 2.
640.ability_html: At the end of your turn, damage the unit to the right by 1, then boost self by 2.
640.flavor: The cruelty of Svalblod priests proved so fierce, so merciless that – upon the cult's collapse – they were condemned and cast out to the high seas aboard longships with nary a paddle nor sail to guide them.

641.name: Svalblod Cultist
641.ability: At the end of your turn, Heal the unit to the left by 1 and damage the unit to the right by 1.
641.ability_html: At the end of your turn, Heal the unit to the left by 1 and damage the unit to the right by 1.
641.keyword_html: Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
641.flavor: They... They's butcherin' folk, Captain! S-sacrifices to a bear god or some such!

642.name: Svalblod Fanatic
642.ability: Berserk 2: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
642.ability_html: Berserk 2: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
642.keyword_html: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
642.flavor: Not all are worthy of Svalblod's blessing.

643.name: Primal Savagery
643.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Also Spawn a Bear Abomination on a random allied row.
643.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Also Spawn a Bear Abomination on a random allied row.
643.keyword_html: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
643.flavor: Not all of Svalblod's worshippers wield bow and blade. They've simply no need.

644.name: Disgraced Brawler
644.ability:
Deploy (Bloodthirst 1): Lock self.
Berserk 3: Destroy self.
644.ability_html: Deploy (Bloodthirst 1): Lock self. Berserk 3: Destroy self.
644.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
644.flavor: Skellige's no home to murderers and rogues... Their crimes must be repaid in blood.

645.name: Bear Abomination
645.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
645.flavor: I'm tellin' youse. Bears fear us more than we fear them. Well... Normal bears, I mean.

646.name: Dettlaff: Higher Vampire
646.ability: Deathwish: Summon self from your graveyard to the same row. This ability is limited to 2 uses and does not refresh when leaving the battlefield.
646.ability_html: Deathwish: Summon self from your graveyard to the same row. This ability is limited to 2 uses and does not refresh when leaving the battlefield.
646.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
646.flavor: In his true form, the Beast of Beauclair could cause even a witcher to quake in his boots.

647.name: Champion of Svalblod
647.ability: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Heal self.
647.ability_html: Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Heal self.
647.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
647.flavor: This bear taste funny to you?

648.name: Treant Mantis: Strike
648.flavor: Don't move! He can't see us if we don't move.

649.name: Courier
649.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Look at the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck and move one to the top.
Deploy (Ranged): Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and move one to the top.
649.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Look at the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck and move one to the top. Deploy (Ranged): Look at the top 3 cards from your deck and move one to the top.
649.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
649.flavor: 'Tis not steel and blood that wins wars, but information.

650.name: Renegade Mage
650.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Tribute 1: Damage by 3 instead.
650.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Tribute 1: Damage by 3 instead.
650.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
650.flavor: I really hope that's boot leather I smell burning...

651.name: Caleb Menge
651.ability:
Profit 3.
Fee 3 (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
Cooldown: 1
651.ability_html: Profit 3. Fee 3 (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. Cooldown: 1
651.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
651.flavor: Deceivers, heretics, witches! They flood our city, corrupt our virtue, and threaten our very way of life!

652.name: Beggar
652.ability_html: Profit 3. Bonded: Profit 5 instead.
652.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
652.flavor: Say what you will about his technique, I think he captured your good side.

653.name: Philippa Eilhart
653.ability: Deploy: Spend a number of Coins equal to an enemy unit's power, then Seize it.
653.ability_html: Deploy: Spend a number of Coins equal to an enemy unit's power, then Seize it.
653.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
653.flavor: Soon the power of kings will wither, and the Lodge shall seize its rightful place.

654.name: Sigi Reuven
654.ability:
Intimidate.
Profit 4.
For each unique Gang category in your starting deck, increase the Profit by 1.
654.ability_html: Intimidate. Profit 4. For each unique Gang category in your starting deck, increase the Profit by 1.
654.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Gang: Criminal organisations including Blindeyes, Crownsplitters, Cutups, Firesworn, Salamandra and Tidecloaks.
654.flavor: You sure he don't look the least bit familar...?

655.name: Vivaldi Bank
655.ability:
Profit 4.
Look at the top card from your deck plus an additional card for each Coin you have. Play the top card for free, or play another card for a Coin cost equal to its distance from the top, then shuffle the remaining cards back into your deck.
655.ability_html: Profit 4. Look at the top card from your deck plus an additional card for each Coin you have. Play the top card for free, or play another card for a Coin cost equal to its distance from the top, then shuffle the remaining cards back into your deck.
655.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
655.flavor: We're sorry to lose your business, but we wish ye well with those dunderhe-- er... With those fine folk over at Cianfanelli Bank.

656.name: Eavesdrop
656.ability:
Profit 5.
Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
656.ability_html: Profit 5. Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
656.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
656.flavor: There are always more ears in the room than those you can count.

657.name: Graden
657.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Destroy the enemy unit with a Bounty.
Tribute 5: Boost self by that unit's base power.
657.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Destroy the enemy unit with a Bounty. Tribute 5: Boost self by that unit's base power.
657.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
657.flavor: Initially, we burned any tomes on black magic we found. Recently we decided it might be wise to read them first.

658.name: Blood Money
658.ability:
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 6, then gain Coins equal to any excess damage dealt.
Whenever an enemy unit with Bounty is destroyed, increase the damage by 1. If the Order is used up, refresh it and set its damage to 1 instead.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
658.ability_html: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 6, then gain Coins equal to any excess damage dealt. Whenever an enemy unit with Bounty is destroyed, increase the damage by 1. If the Order is used up, refresh it and set its damage to 1 instead. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
658.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
658.flavor: A war with Whoreson will see Novigrad's gutters run red with blood.

659.name: Kurt
659.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
659.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
659.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Purify: Remove all statuses.
659.flavor: Oy, Kurt, find out what Merigold's hollerin' about, if she needs anything. A hot iron to the tongue, maybe?

660.name: Moreelse
660.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Tribute 6: Destroy it instead.
660.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4. Tribute 6: Destroy it instead.
660.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
660.flavor: Some witch hunters truly believed the eradication of mages and sorceresses would make the world a better place. Moreelse did not require such a lofty justification.

661.name: Blindeye Apothecary
661.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Heal an allied unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 4.
Tribute 2: Combine both Deploy abilities instead.
661.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Heal an allied unit. Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 4. Tribute 2: Combine both Deploy abilities instead.
661.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
661.flavor: After her husband died in a tragic carriage accident, she threw herself completely into her work.

662.name: Horst Borsodi
662.ability:
Deploy: Gain 3 Coins. If Ewald Borsodi is in your graveyard, gain 6 Coins instead.
Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality (1).
662.ability_html: Deploy: Gain 3 Coins. If Ewald Borsodi is in your graveyard, gain 6 Coins instead. Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality (1).
662.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
662.flavor: My auction house is, above all, a gathering place for the elite of the elite.

663.name: Sly Seductress
663.ability:
Fee 3: Gain a Shield.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, boost self by 1.
Bonded: Whenever your opponent plays a card, boost self by 1.
663.ability_html: Fee 3: Gain a Shield. Whenever your opponent plays a unit, boost self by 1. Bonded: Whenever your opponent plays a card, boost self by 1.
663.keyword_html: Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
663.flavor: The sweeter her words, the more bitter your losses.

664.name: Ewald Borsodi
664.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If Horst Borsodi is in your graveyard, damage by 4 instead.
Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (1).
664.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. If Horst Borsodi is in your graveyard, damage by 4 instead. Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (1).
664.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
664.flavor: I've crafted this plan for over a year, but now the time's come for action. Can I count on your help?

665.name: Pickpocket
665.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
665.flavor: My apologies, miss... Always been a clumsy one, I have.

666.name: Tamara Strenger
666.ability:
Deploy: Boost all allied Witch Hunters by 1.
Tribute 3: Boost all allied Witch Hunters in hand, deck and on the battlefield by 1 instead.
666.ability_html: Deploy: Boost all allied Witch Hunters by 1. Tribute 3: Boost all allied Witch Hunters in hand, deck and on the battlefield by 1 instead.
666.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
666.flavor: Once the heat of the Fire has set your heart aflame, it gives you strength and leads you down the path of truth for the rest of your life.

667.name: Whoreson Senior
667.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Transform an adjacent unit into a Cutup Lackey.
Tribute 3: Transform adjacent units into Cutup Lackeys instead.
667.ability_html: Intimidate. Deploy: Transform an adjacent unit into a Cutup Lackey. Tribute 3: Transform adjacent units into Cutup Lackeys instead.
667.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.

668.name: Adriano the Mink
668.ability:
Profit 2.
Increase the Profit by 1 for each allied Sly Seductress.
Tribute 5: Spawn a Sly Seductress on this row.
668.ability_html: Profit 2. Increase the Profit by 1 for each allied Sly Seductress. Tribute 5: Spawn a Sly Seductress on this row.

668.flavor: Right here, beautiful. Have a sit on daddy's lap.

669.name: Back-Alley Chemist
669.ability: Zeal. Order: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2.
669.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2.
669.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
669.flavor: I do this for my family, always for my family!

670.name: Adalbertus Kalkstein
670.ability_html: Profit 2. Fee 2: Purify a unit.
670.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Purify: Remove all statuses.
670.flavor: Before Kalkstein departed this world, he left us with some rather unflattering words about our gracious king...

671.name: Oxenfurt Naturalist
671.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality (1).
671.ability_html: Profit 2. Fee 1: Give an allied unit Vitality (1).
671.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
671.flavor: When handling mandrake, you must always remember to don a pair of protective... Wait, where are my gloves?

672.name: Rico Meiersdorf
672.ability: Whenever opponent plays a unit while Rico is in your hand or deck, set his power equal to that unit's power.
672.ability_html: Whenever opponent plays a unit while Rico is in your hand or deck, set his power equal to that unit's power.
672.flavor: I never did much like bees.

673.name: Witch Hunter Executioner
673.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (1). If it has a Bounty, damage it by 1 instead.
673.ability_html: Profit 2. Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (1). If it has a Bounty, damage it by 1 instead.
673.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
673.flavor: It'd be a right shame if I cut any of your beautiful hair.

674.name: Slander
674.ability:
Profit 3.
Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
674.ability_html: Profit 3. Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
674.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
674.flavor: All Novigradians have two great passions: coin and hearsay.

675.name: Witch Hunter
675.ability: Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
675.ability_html: Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
675.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
675.flavor: Long coats, wide-brimmed hats, and crooked grins – witch hunters are hard to miss.

676.name: Madame Luiza
676.ability:
Intimidate.
Tribute 3: Gain Zeal.
Order: Your next Tribute this round costs 0.

Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
676.flavor: We've bedded more men than all Redania's army barracks combined.

677.name: Fisstech
677.ability_html: Profit 4. Poison a unit.
677.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
677.flavor: Large pupils, chattering teeth, a mad cackle... Aye, that's fisstech for ye.

678.name: Igor the Hook
678.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 5: Spawn a base copy of a bronze allied unit on this row.
Cooldown: 1
678.ability_html: Insanity. Fee 5: Spawn a base copy of a bronze allied unit on this row. Cooldown: 1
678.keyword_html: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
678.flavor: In the left corner, a bloodthirsty shaelmaar, and in the right co--oh bollocks... Fight's over, hold your bets!

679.name: Tinboy
679.ability:
Deploy: Damage all units on an enemy row by 2.
Tribute 8: Damage all enemy units by 2 instead.
679.ability_html: Deploy: Damage all units on an enemy row by 2. Tribute 8: Damage all enemy units by 2 instead.
679.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
679.flavor: Tinboy's old man labored as a metalworker. On his sober days, he smelted tin. On his drinking days, he smelted his son's face.

680.name: Doadrick Leumaerts
680.ability:
Deploy: If you control an Agent, gain Zeal.
Order (Ranged): Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
Cooldown: 1
680.ability_html: Deploy: If you control an Agent, gain Zeal. Order (Ranged): Draw a card, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Cooldown: 1

Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
680.flavor: The emperor has high expectations for you. See that you do not disappoint him. Hael Ker'zaer!

681.name: Tatterwing
681.ability:
Immunity.
At the start of the game, set the power of all other units in your deck to 1 and own power to 25.

681.keyword_html: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
681.flavor: She seems a bit sluggish. A few quick jabs to the ribs oughta liven her up.

682.name: Off the Books
682.ability:
Order: Gain 2 Coins.
Charges: 4
Your Tributes cost 1 Coin less.

Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
682.flavor: Titles and trinkets don't interest me. I desire power, and power alone.

683.name: Dip in the Pontar
683.ability:
Profit 3.
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
683.ability_html: Profit 3. Damage an enemy unit by 3.
683.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
683.flavor: The Pontar's got more bodies than fish these days.

684.name: Payday
684.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Gain a Coin for each point of excess damage dealt.
684.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Gain a Coin for each point of excess damage dealt.
684.keyword_html: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
684.flavor: I-I already gave ye all me coin!

685.name: Tidecloak Hideaway
685.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 1 for each Pirate in your hand.
685.ability_html: Deploy (Ranged): Boost an allied unit by 1 for each Pirate in your hand.
685.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
685.flavor: Once a terror of the high seas, it now sits idle and fat with gold, unable to leave port.

686.ability_html: Deploy: Damage a random allied unit by 3. If there are no allied units, damage self by 5 instead.
686.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
686.flavor: Listen, troll, I can promise you a hundred crowns if you take the fa--AAAAAAGH!!!

687.name: Boris
687.ability:
At the start of your turn, wherever this card is, randomly change own Fee to a different cost between 1 and 9.
Fee 1: Move self to the other row, then boost self by the Fee cost. If you have 0 Coins, also gain 1 Coin for each allied unit on that row.
Cooldown: 1

687.flavor: After getting a taste of human flesh, he won't eat anything else.

689.keyword_html: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
689.flavor: I'd sell me own mum for a whiff. And I'd cut 'er throat for two.

690.ability_html: Create a 4-provision cost unit with a Fee.
690.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
690.flavor: Wouldn't be right to let all this rot in port. We's doin' 'em a favor, really.

691.name: Whoreson's Freak Show

Profit 2.
Fee 2 (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.

693.flavor: There's more wealth in Novigrad than in all of Skellige – and the number of poor saps to match.

Fee 2: Boost self by 2.
Hoard 7: Boost by 3 instead.

695.flavor: You ever lift rings off a body that's been left to soak for two weeks? No? Then don't complain.

696.name: Kikimore Warrior

696.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
696.flavor: Come spring, the buggers start to burst through the woodwork. Literally.

697.keyword_html: Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
697.flavor: Illiterate, ye say? A moment, if ye could. I'll draw us up another agreement...

698.name: Fence

Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
699.flavor: Addictive? Why, not at all! I've quit several times before!

Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
701.flavor: Hierarch of the Eternal Fire, enthusiast of the arena, glutton of feasts, and luster of whores.

702.ability_html: Whenever you play a unit next to Prophet Lebioda, give it a Shield.
702.keyword_html: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
702.flavor: To thine own self be judge and ruler for thou alone shalt answer for thine deeds before thee.

703.name: Sacred Flame
703.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on each side of this card.
Order: Boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
703.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on each side of this card. Order: Boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
703.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
703.flavor: Do you feel it? I sense something else beyond its warmth, something more...

704.name: Grand Inquisitor Helveed
704.ability:
Profit 4.
Fee 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on this row.
704.ability_html: Profit 4. Fee 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on this row.
704.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
704.flavor: No sinful wretch shall escape his fate in the Fire. Of that, I will make sure.

705.name: Arena Endrega
705.ability: Deploy: Gain Coins equal to the amount an allied unit is damaged.
705.ability_html: Deploy: Gain Coins equal to the amount an allied unit is damaged.
705.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
705.flavor: Strong as an ox, dumb as a box.

706.name: Damnation
706.ability: Destroy an allied unit and Create and play a 4-provision cost Firesworn unit. Increase the provision value by the power of the destroyed unit.
706.ability_html: Destroy an allied unit and Create and play a 4-provision cost Firesworn unit. Increase the provision value by the power of the destroyed unit.
706.keyword_html: Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
706.flavor: I can't bloody breathe! Won't they burn the wretches someplace else?

707.name: Nathaniel Pastodi
707.ability: Whenever Nathaniel receives a boost, give a random enemy unit Bleeding (2).
707.ability_html: Whenever Nathaniel receives a boost, give a random enemy unit Bleeding (2).
707.keyword_html: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
707.flavor: Novigrad – where the impossible becomes possible. A professional torturer turned reverend, for instance.

708.name: Procession of Penance
708.ability: Deploy: Damage self by 10. Reduce the damage by 2 for each Firesworn Token you control.
708.ability_html: Deploy: Damage self by 10. Reduce the damage by 2 for each Firesworn Token you control.
708.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
708.flavor: Careful not to stand too close. Got blood splattered on me favorite tunic last time.

709.name: Sukrus
709.ability: Prevent the unit to the left of Sukrus from taking any damage.
709.ability_html: Prevent the unit to the left of Sukrus from taking any damage.
709.flavor: One of many who sought fortune in Novigrad. And one of many more who never found it.

710.name: Excommunication
710.ability: Banish an allied unit, then play the top card from your deck. If the target was a Firesworn, look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play 1 of them instead.
710.ability_html: Banish an allied unit, then play the top card from your deck. If the target was a Firesworn, look at the top 3 cards from your deck and play 1 of them instead.
710.keyword_html: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
710.flavor: Aye, better than the pyre, I suppose... But did ye hear the disappointment in his voice? Now that's real sufferin'.

711.name: Arena Ghoul
711.ability:
Deploy: At the end of this turn, destroy self.
Tribute 1: Cancel the Deploy ability.
711.ability_html: Deploy: At the end of this turn, destroy self. Tribute 1: Cancel the Deploy ability.
711.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
711.flavor: He'll be a perfect fit for your arena. Just like a mutt lickin' your plate after dinner.

712.name: Tavern Brawl

712.ability_html: Force an enemy unit to Duel an adjacent unit.
712.keyword_html: Duel: Units take turns dealing damage equal to their power until one of them is destroyed.
712.flavor: About time we had some entertainment! My knuckles are itchin'!

713.name: Firesworn Zealot
713.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
713.flavor: Great is my faith, and great is my ire!

714.name: Wheel of Fortune
714.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 0. At the end of your turn, while in hand or deck, change this value to a random number between 1 and 10.
714.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 0. At the end of your turn, while in hand or deck, change this value to a random number between 1 and 10.
714.flavor: A game where good aim is considered subjective.

715.name: Bincy Blumerholdt
715.ability: Ranged: Whenever you gain Coins, boost self by 1 for each Coin gained.
715.ability_html: Ranged: Whenever you gain Coins, boost self by 1 for each Coin gained.
715.keyword_html: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
715.flavor: In all Novigrad, she has the hairiest feet and the stickiest hands.

716.name: Eternal Fire Priest

716.ability_html: Whenever you Spawn one or more units on the battlefield, boost self by 1.
716.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
716.flavor: Closer, my sheep, gather closer. May the Eternal Fire warm your souls!

717.name: Cutup Lackey

Whenever you play a Crime, damage a random enemy unit by 1.

717.flavor: The boss always gets to have the most fun. Truth be told, I prefer to watch anyway.

718.name: Hammond

719.name: Eternal Fire Inquisitor
