720.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
720.flavor: Look into your hearts, dear brethen. Does a contempt for injustice not burn within it?

721.name: The Flying Redanian
721.ability: Hoard 9: At the end of your turn, Summon self from your deck or graveyard to a random allied row.
721.ability_html: Hoard 9: At the end of your turn, Summon self from your deck or graveyard to a random allied row.
721.keyword_html: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
721.flavor: Legend tells of a Redanian crew from generations past who unearthed a treasure so great they became forever destined to argue amongst themselves on how to divide their spoils.

722.name: Casino Bouncers
722.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 1: Summon all copies of self from your deck to this row.
722.ability_html: Insanity. Fee 1: Summon all copies of self from your deck to this row.
722.keyword_html: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
722.flavor: Junior said our nasty mugs was frightenin' off all the coin. Don't rightly see 'ow this helps any...

723.name: Keeper of the Flame
723.ability:
Deploy: Boost adjacent units by 1.
Tribute 4: Boost all units on this row by 1 instead.
Decrease this card's Tribute cost by 1 for each allied Cleric.
723.ability_html: Deploy: Boost adjacent units by 1. Tribute 4: Boost all units on this row by 1 instead. Decrease this card's Tribute cost by 1 for each allied Cleric.
723.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
723.flavor: The flame shall forever burn, for evil shall forever corrupt!

724.name: Imke
724.ability:
Ranged: At the end of your turn, gain 2 Coins.
Fee 3: Gain a Shield.
724.ability_html: Ranged: At the end of your turn, gain 2 Coins. Fee 3: Gain a Shield.
724.keyword_html: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
724.flavor: No sooner had she caught Gudrun's attention than sought to exploit it.

725.name: Bloody Good Fun
725.ability:
Profit 4.
Spend all your Coins and damage an enemy unit by the same amount.
725.ability_html: Profit 4. Spend all your Coins and damage an enemy unit by the same amount.
725.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
725.flavor: What do ye mean, Why? The game was beginnin' to drag!

726.name: Temple Guard
726.ability: Deploy (Melee): Boost 3 adjacent allied units by 1.
726.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Boost 3 adjacent allied units by 1.
726.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
726.flavor: Halt! Who goes there?! Firesworn or heretic?

727.name: Jackpot
727.ability:
Order: Gain 9 Coins, then boost an allied unit by any excess amount gained.
Whenever an allied unit gives you Coins, boost it by any excess amount gained.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
727.ability_html: Order: Gain 9 Coins, then boost an allied unit by any excess amount gained. Whenever an allied unit gives you Coins, boost it by any excess amount gained. This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
727.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
727.flavor: Any hopes that a woman's presence might soften the city's underbelly proved misguided. Horribly, woefully misguided.

728.name: Congregation
728.ability: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots on an allied row. If there is a Firesworn unit on that row, Spawn 3 Firesworn Zealots instead.
728.ability_html: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots on an allied row. If there is a Firesworn unit on that row, Spawn 3 Firesworn Zealots instead.
728.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
728.flavor: Our church is not this temple, not our scripture. It is our people, our community, we who have faith.

729.name: Halfling Safecracker
729.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Crime in your hand.
729.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Crime in your hand.
729.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
729.flavor: With ears sharp as his, he could've been a musician. Alas, one cannot get rich as quickly from applause.

730.name: Firesworn Scribe
730.ability:
Ranged: Whenever you Spawn one or more units on the battlefield, gain 1 Coin.
Tribute 2: Boost self by 2.
730.ability_html: Ranged: Whenever you Spawn one or more units on the battlefield, gain 1 Coin. Tribute 2: Boost self by 2.
730.keyword_html: Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
730.flavor: Wouldn't disturb him if I were you. Those quills are bloody sharp.

731.name: Bare-Knuckle Brawler
731.ability:
Intimidate.
Fee 1: Damage the highest-power enemy unit by 1.
731.ability_html: Intimidate. Fee 1: Damage the highest-power enemy unit by 1.
731.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
731.flavor: Is tha' all that's left of 'im?\nThink I'm goin' tae boak...

732.name: Shakedown
732.ability:
Profit 3.
Boost an allied unit by 3.
732.ability_html: Profit 3. Boost an allied unit by 3.
732.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
732.flavor: Nae need to be stingy, pal. There's plenty to go 'round.

733.name: Coerced Blacksmith
733.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Boost an allied unit by 1.
733.ability_html: Profit 2. Fee 1: Boost an allied unit by 1.
733.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
733.flavor: Do ye prefer a full coin purse or a full set of fingers?

734.name: Swindle
734.ability:
Profit 4 - 6.
For each allied Crownsplitters, increase the minimal amount by 1.
734.ability_html: Profit 4 - 6. For each allied Crownsplitters, increase the minimal amount by 1.
734.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins.
734.flavor: There are a hundred ways to fleece a sheep. And Cleaver's crew knew them all.

735.name: Cleaver's Muscle
735.keyword_html: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
735.flavor: Those who try to cheat Cleaver are in for a rude awakening... And a rough landing.

736.name: Crownsplitter Thug
736.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
736.ability_html: Intimidate. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
736.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
736.flavor: Frilly frock or Mahakam steel breastplate – wouldn't have mattered.

737.name: Harald Gord
737.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 0.
Increase the boost by 1 for each special card you played this game. The boost cannot exceed 12.
737.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 0. Increase the boost by 1 for each special card you played this game. The boost cannot exceed 12.
737.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
737.flavor: The last occasion Harald's grim countenance betrayed a smile was in 1211 when Brouver Hoog drunkenly ate five bowls of goat and cabbage stew then promptly shat his trousers.

738.name: Novigradian Justice
738.ability: Play a bronze Dwarf or Crownsplitter unit from your deck. If you already control a Dwarf or Crownsplitter, also Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on your Melee row.
738.ability_html: Play a bronze Dwarf or Crownsplitter unit from your deck. If you already control a Dwarf or Crownsplitter, also Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on your Melee row.
738.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
738.flavor: With both arms tied behind me back, recall ye said. So feel free to start kickin' me in the arse when the mood strikes ye.

739.name: Sir Skewertooth
739.ability_html: Intimidate 2. Tribute 2: Gain Immunity.
739.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted.
739.flavor: Here he is! My knight in swining armor!

740.name: Tunnel Drill
740.ability:
Profit 2.
Fee 2: Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Cooldown: 1
Whenever you play a Crime, reduce the Cooldown by 1.
740.ability_html: Profit 2. Fee 2: Damage an enemy unit by 3. Cooldown: 1 Whenever you play a Crime, reduce the Cooldown by 1.
740.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
740.flavor: Though originally designed for mining excavations under Mount Carbon, the machine struck more gold under the streets of Novigrad.

741.name: Caesar Bilzen
741.ability:
Deploy: Trigger the Profit abilities of adjacent units.
Fee 2: Boost an allied unit by 2.
741.ability_html: Deploy: Trigger the Profit abilities of adjacent units. Fee 2: Boost an allied unit by 2.
741.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
741.flavor: Avid angler, meticulous collector, and a real piece of work.

742.name: The Sausage Maker
742.ability_html: Intimidate. Profit 3. Fee 3 (Melee): Gain Resilience.
742.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round.
742.flavor: Body disposal and sausage makin', that's what I do. And judgin' by that expression, I'd say ye already ken th' answer to your follow-up question.

743.name: Ferko the Sculptor
743.ability: Deploy (Melee): Play a Crime from your deck.
743.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Play a Crime from your deck.
743.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
743.flavor: Some call it base thuggery. But me, I consider it the highest art form.

744.name: Pirate's Cove
744.ability:
Order: Spawn a Sea Jackal on an allied row.
Charges: 2

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
744.ability_html: Order: Spawn a Sea Jackal on an allied row. Charges: 2 This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provisions limit.
744.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
744.flavor: Me hogs willnae go hungry th' day thanks to ye.

745.name: Walter Veritas
745.ability: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Syndicate card.
745.ability_html: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Syndicate card.
745.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
745.flavor: In a city that feeds on lies, truth can be a weapon.

746.name: Geralt: Axii
746.ability: Deploy: Seize a unit with power up to the number of allied Witchers on this row.
746.ability_html: Deploy: Seize a unit with power up to the number of allied Witchers on this row.
746.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
746.flavor: Placing his left arm around the horse's neck, Geralt makes the Axii sign with the fingers of his right hand above the steed's head and whispers the incantation.

747.name: Knickers
747.ability: This unit may raid the battlefield to aid you in battle.
747.ability_html: This unit may raid the battlefield to aid you in battle.
747.flavor: Leave it alone, Knickers! Damn it, leave it alone!

748.name: Olgierd: Immortal
748.ability: This card's power cannot be changed by other abilities.
748.ability_html: This card's power cannot be changed by other abilities.
748.flavor: All of my dreams have come true. Unfortunately.

749.name: Iris: Shade
749.ability: Deploy: Remove a unit's Armor and boost self by that amount.
749.ability_html: Deploy: Remove a unit's Armor and boost self by that amount.
749.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
749.flavor: Olgierd's betrothed was like a dream…

750.name: Gascon: Iron Falcon
750.ability: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Neutral Bandit unit.
750.ability_html: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Neutral Bandit unit.
750.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
750.flavor: I'm doing what I used to do and they're paying me for it!

751.name: One-Eyed Betsy
751.ability:
Deploy: Draw up to 2 Bonded units, then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck.
Order: Replay an allied Bonded unit.
751.ability_html: Deploy: Draw up to 2 Bonded units, then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck. Order: Replay an allied Bonded unit.
751.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
751.flavor: Maybe she lacks depth perception, but she sure packs a wallop.

752.name: Vlodimir von Everec
752.ability: Deploy: Swap a unit's power with Armor.
752.ability_html: Deploy: Swap a unit's power with Armor.
752.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
752.flavor: Vlodimir liked to have a good time when he was alive and greatly missed having fun after his death.

753.name: Free Company
753.ability:
Order: Choose an allied Bonded unit, then play its top copy from your deck.
Cooldown: 3
753.ability_html: Order: Choose an allied Bonded unit, then play its top copy from your deck. Cooldown: 3
753.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
753.flavor: It's because we're free to do whatever we want! Ha, ha, ha!

754.name: Living Armor
754.ability: This unit's power is always equal to its Armor.
754.ability_html: This unit's power is always equal to its Armor.
754.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
754.flavor: Sure it's expensive. But considering how much you'll save on room and board, you'll get a return on the investment by the end of this century!

755.name: Armory
755.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 6.
Order: Give an allied unit 3 Armor.
755.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Boost an allied unit by 6. Order: Give an allied unit 3 Armor.
755.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
755.flavor: Guisarmes? Maces? Spiked Maces? I have everything you could possibly need.

756.name: Surrender
756.ability: Remove 2 Armor from all units on a row and damage them by 2.
756.ability_html: Remove 2 Armor from all units on a row and damage them by 2.
756.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
756.flavor: There's no shame in waving the white flag.

757.name: Wagenburg
757.ability: Barricade: At the end of your turn, give 1 Armor to adjacent units.
757.ability_html: Barricade: At the end of your turn, give 1 Armor to adjacent units.
757.keyword_html: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
757.flavor: Dh'oine can turn anything into a weapon. Even a simple wagon…

758.name: Iron Falcon Knife Juggler
758.ability:
Zeal. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Bonded: Also give it Bleeding (1).
Whenever you play a Bonded unit, refresh the Order.
758.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Bonded: Also give it Bleeding (1). Whenever you play a Bonded unit, refresh the Order.
758.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
758.flavor: The weapon's short, but its range is long.

759.name: Iron Falcon Infantry
759.ability:
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on its row.
Bonded: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 instead.
759.ability_html: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if this is the only card on its row. Bonded: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 instead.
759.keyword_html: Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
759.flavor: You have to look good on the battlefield too.

760.name: Iron Falcon Troubadour
760.ability: Deploy: Spawn a 1-power Locked copy of a Bonded unit from your starting deck on this row.
760.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn a 1-power Locked copy of a Bonded unit from your starting deck on this row.
760.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card.
760.flavor: When I play even dying's more pleasant.

761.name: Piercing Missile
761.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 4, ignoring its Armor.
761.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 4, ignoring its Armor.
761.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
761.flavor: There's no armor that can't be pierced.

762.name: Wagon
762.ability:
Deploy: Banish the bronze unit to the right, then gain Resilience.
Order: Transform self into a base copy of the Banished unit.
Exposed: Purify self.
762.ability_html: Deploy: Banish the bronze unit to the right, then gain Resilience. Order: Transform self into a base copy of the Banished unit. Exposed: Purify self.
762.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor. Purify: Remove all statuses.
762.flavor: The driver swore he was carrying seeds. But seeds don't clank on bumps in the road…

763.name: Mantlet
763.ability:
Melee: Whenever you play a unit, give it 1 Armor.
Barricade: Give it 2 Armor instead.
763.ability_html: Melee: Whenever you play a unit, give it 1 Armor. Barricade: Give it 2 Armor instead.
763.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
763.flavor: Something like the bastard child of a shield and a palisade.

764.name: Sapper
764.ability:
Deploy: Play a Bomb from your hand, then draw a card.
Barricade: Whenever you play a Bomb, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
764.ability_html: Deploy: Play a Bomb from your hand, then draw a card. Barricade: Whenever you play a Bomb, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
764.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
764.flavor: Aim wherever you want. The shrapnel will take care of it.

765.name: Highwaymen
765.ability:
When you play a Bonded unit that you already control a copy of, Summon self from your deck to your Melee row.
Exposed: Move self to the top of your deck.
765.ability_html: When you play a Bonded unit that you already control a copy of, Summon self from your deck to your Melee row. Exposed: Move self to the top of your deck.
765.keyword_html: Bonded: Trigger this ability if you control a copy of this card. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
765.flavor: We'll torture the merchant and sell the horses.

766.name: Armorer's Workshop
766.ability: Boost 3 adjacent units by 2 and give them 2 Armor. If you have an Armorer's Workshop in your graveyard, boost 3 adjacent units by 3 and give them 3 Armor instead.
766.ability_html: Boost 3 adjacent units by 2 and give them 2 Armor. If you have an Armorer's Workshop in your graveyard, boost 3 adjacent units by 3 and give them 3 Armor instead.
766.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
766.flavor: He'll make a helm out of a pot if need be.

767.name: Philippa: Blind Fury
767.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then damage a random enemy unit by 3, then 2, then 1.
767.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then damage a random enemy unit by 3, then 2, then 1.
767.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
767.flavor: Philippa Eilhart, though very attractive, was decidedly very unkind.

768.name: Donimir of Troy
768.keyword_html: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.
768.flavor: I fought twice at Sodden and lived. I think you can surmise I'm not so bad at this sword thing.

769.name: Voymir
769.ability: Deploy: Boost an allied unit and all its copies by 1 and give them 1 Armor.
769.ability_html: Deploy: Boost an allied unit and all its copies by 1 and give them 1 Armor.
769.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
769.flavor: Quietly, on tiptoes, no noise, no fuss. Through the back alleys. In Loxia and the port keep your mouth shut! Go!

770.name: Mad Charge
770.ability:
Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it 2 Armor.
If it's a Knight, also give it Vitality (2).
770.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 5 and give it 2 Armor. If it's a Knight, also give it Vitality (2).
770.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
770.flavor: You can't stop a galloping cavalry horse. So if things go bad, the only thing to do is to lower your lance, close your eyes and pray to the gods.

771.name: Radovid's Royal Guards
771.ability:
Formation.
Order: Boost an allied unit by 2.
Inspired: Give it 2 Armor.
771.ability_html: Formation. Order: Boost an allied unit by 2. Inspired: Give it 2 Armor.
771.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
771.flavor: They'll do anything for their king. They know what he'll do to them if they refuse.

772.name: Redanian Archer
772.ability:
Zeal. Order (Ranged): Damage an enemy unit by 1. 
Charge: 1
Barricade: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Charge.

772.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
772.flavor: The last thing you'll hear is the twang of the bowstring being let go.

773.name: Azar Javed
773.ability:
Profit 3.
Deploy: Spawn a Scarab on this row.
Tribute 3: Spawn 2 Scarabs on this row instead.
773.ability_html: Profit 3. Deploy: Spawn a Scarab on this row. Tribute 3: Spawn 2 Scarabs on this row instead.
773.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
773.flavor: Azar Javed's specialty is the element of fire. The sorcerer not only deftly manipulates the power of fire, it can be said that fire has become a part of his very being.

774.name: Professor
774.ability:
Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit and damage it by 4.
Tribute 3: Ignore the target unit's Armor.
774.ability_html: Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit and damage it by 4. Tribute 3: Ignore the target unit's Armor.
774.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
774.flavor: I fear our conventicle may end disastrously for you.

775.name: Savolla
775.ability:
Profit 2.
Tribute 9: Spawn Savolla's Frightener on this row.
775.ability_html: Profit 2. Tribute 9: Spawn Savolla's Frightener on this row.
775.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
775.flavor: Witcher mutagens are a forgotten treasure. It's time the world learned of their potential.

776.name: Dire Mutated Hound
776.ability:
Barricade: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2.
Fee 4: Gain 1 Armor.
776.ability_html: Barricade: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2. Fee 4: Gain 1 Armor.
776.keyword_html: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
776.flavor: We couldn't decide what to name him and it just kind of came up…

777.name: Mutated Hounds
777.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2).
Deploy (Ranged): Poison a unit.
777.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2). Deploy (Ranged): Poison a unit.
777.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
777.flavor: Out of man's best friend we made his worst enemy.

778.name: Assault
778.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 4. If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, damage by 6 instead.
778.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 4. If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, damage by 6 instead.
778.flavor: Human life is fragile. Especially in Novigrad.

779.name: Salamandra Assassin
779.ability:
Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit.
Order: Poison the enemy unit with a Bounty.
779.ability_html: Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. Order: Poison the enemy unit with a Bounty.
779.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
779.flavor: A name and bag full of gold. That's all I need.

780.name: Mutant Killer
780.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Poisoned unit on the battlefield.
780.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Poisoned unit on the battlefield.
780.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
780.flavor: You have to keep him on a leash, muzzled and with blinders on, otherwise it'll be trouble.

781.name: Mutant
781.ability:
When Poisoned, Spawn a base copy of self on this row.
Counter: 1
781.ability_html: When Poisoned, Spawn a base copy of self on this row. Counter: 1
781.keyword_html: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
781.flavor: With the right tools you can shape the human body like wet clay.

782.name: Kikimore Queen
782.ability:
Thrive.
Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, boost all allied Insectoids on this row by 1.
Whenever you play an Organic card, trigger own Thrive.
782.ability_html: Thrive. Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, boost all allied Insectoids on this row by 1. Whenever you play an Organic card, trigger own Thrive.
782.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power.
782.flavor: Many insectoids live in a matriarchy. A bloody one at that.

783.name: Cave Troll
783.keyword_html: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row.
783.flavor: Trolls have very tiny brains and huge stomachs. That's a very dangerous combination.

784.name: Yghern
784.ability:
Deploy: Gain Armor equal to the number of cards in your hand.
If this unit has no Armor, destroy self.
784.ability_html: Deploy: Gain Armor equal to the number of cards in your hand. If this unit has no Armor, destroy self.
784.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
784.flavor: Its other name is scolopendromorph. Rarely used, as it's hard to say without spitting all over oneself.

785.name: Endrega Queen
785.ability:
Deploy: Consume an allied unit and gain Armor equal to its provision cost.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1, then Spawn a Drone on this row.
785.ability_html: Deploy: Consume an allied unit and gain Armor equal to its provision cost. Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1, then Spawn a Drone on this row.
785.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
785.flavor: The Endrega Queen can be easily recognized by the specific coloring of its abdomen. Or, more easily, by its monstrous size

786.name: Armored Arachas
786.ability:
Deploy: If there is another card on this row, Lock self.
Timer 3: If this row is full, boost self by 12.
786.ability_html: Deploy: If there is another card on this row, Lock self. Timer 3: If this row is full, boost self by 12.
786.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Timer: Before the end of your turn, lower the number by 1. When the number reaches 0, trigger the ability.
786.flavor: It can cut half-inch thick metal like a tailor cutting silk.

787.name: Endrega Larva
787.ability:
Thrive.
Deploy: Spawn a base copy of self on this row.
787.ability_html: Thrive. Deploy: Spawn a base copy of self on this row.
787.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.

788.name: Endrega Warrior
788.ability:
Deploy: Consume your adjacent units. For each Consumed Insectoid, gain 1 Charge.
Zeal. Order: Spawn a Drone on this row.
Charge: 1
788.ability_html: Deploy: Consume your adjacent units. For each Consumed Insectoid, gain 1 Charge. Zeal. Order: Spawn a Drone on this row. Charge: 1
788.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
788.flavor: Where I come from no one was afraid of the Big Bad Wolf or Baba Yaga. Instead, we had an Endrega nest in the shrubs beyond the village.

789.name: Natural Selection
789.ability: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then Spawn a Drone on a random allied row for each point of excess damage dealt.
789.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 4, then Spawn a Drone on a random allied row for each point of excess damage dealt.
789.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
789.flavor: The strongest will survive. So not you.

790.name: Kikimore Worker
790.ability:
Whenever you play an Insectoid, gain 1 Armor.
Exposed: Destroy self.
790.ability_html: Whenever you play an Insectoid, gain 1 Armor. Exposed: Destroy self.
790.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
790.flavor: They say it can eat a whole man in armor down to the bone in less than a minute. I'd rather not find out if it's true.

791.name: Endrega Eggs
791.ability: Deathwish: Spawn 3 Drones on this row.
791.ability_html: Deathwish: Spawn 3 Drones on this row.
791.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
791.flavor: If you find some it's best to burn the entire forest down. Then run as far away as you can.

792.name: Affan Hillergrand
792.ability:
Once all leader Charges are used up, Summon self from your deck to a random allied row. If you control at least 4 units with Flanking, play self instead and gain Zeal.
Order: Boost all allied Soldiers with Armor by 1.
792.ability_html: Once all leader Charges are used up, Summon self from your deck to a random allied row. If you control at least 4 units with Flanking, play self instead and gain Zeal. Order: Boost all allied Soldiers with Armor by 1.
792.keyword_html: Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Flanking: If this unit is adjacent to only one card: on your Melee row, its end of turn ability is triggered twice; on your Ranged row, gain 1 Armor at the end of your turn. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
792.flavor: Jarre doesn't mention him in his books. Maybe he never heard of him. Maybe he heard too much.

793.name: Ramon Tyrconnel
793.ability: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Soldier from your hand and give it 2 Armor.
793.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Soldier from your hand and give it 2 Armor.
793.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
793.flavor: Colonel Ramon Tyrconnel, the young commander of the Ard Feainn division, whistled softly, staring at a point somewhere off in the distance…

794.name: War Council
794.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Look at the first 3 cards from the top of your deck and play one of them.
Order: Spawn and play Battle Preparation.
794.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Look at the first 3 cards from the top of your deck and play one of them. Order: Spawn and play Battle Preparation.
794.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
794.flavor: Nilfgaardians fight every battle twice: first on the map, then in reality.

795.name: Ffion var Gaernel
795.ability:
Defender.
Deploy: Spawn and play Battle Preparation.
795.ability_html: Defender. Deploy: Spawn and play Battle Preparation.
795.keyword_html: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
795.flavor: Everyone will die somehow. I'll die last.

796.name: Glynnis aep Loernach
796.keyword_html: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck.
796.flavor: She loved every soldier like a son. She cried for each one.

797.name: Ard Feainn Crossbowman
797.ability:
Flanking.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 1 if you played a Soldier this turn.
797.ability_html: Flanking. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 1 if you played a Soldier this turn.
797.keyword_html: Flanking: If this unit is adjacent to only one card: on your Melee row, its end of turn ability is triggered twice; on your Ranged row, gain 1 Armor at the end of your turn. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
797.flavor: Many thought that mounted crossbowmen wouldn't work. Until they saw them in action.

798.name: Ard Feainn Tortoise
798.ability: Exposed: Boost the highest-power enemy unit by 3.
798.ability_html: Exposed: Boost the highest-power enemy unit by 3.
798.keyword_html: Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
798.flavor: Close formation, clench your sphincters! Left, right, left, steady!

799.name: Ard Feainn Light Cavalry
799.ability:
Flanking.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage the last unit played by your opponent by 1.
799.ability_html: Flanking. Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage the last unit played by your opponent by 1.
799.keyword_html: Flanking: If this unit is adjacent to only one card: on your Melee row, its end of turn ability is triggered twice; on your Ranged row, gain 1 Armor at the end of your turn. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.

800.name: Ard Feainn Heavy Cavalry
800.ability:
Flanking.
At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
Ranged: When this unit reaches 5 Armor, move self to the Melee row.
Barricade (Melee): Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, lose all Armor and damage it by the same amount, then Lock self.
800.ability_html: Flanking. At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor. Ranged: When this unit reaches 5 Armor, move self to the Melee row. Barricade (Melee): Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, lose all Armor and damage it by the same amount, then Lock self.
800.keyword_html: Flanking: If this unit is adjacent to only one card: on your Melee row, its end of turn ability is triggered twice; on your Ranged row, gain 1 Armor at the end of your turn. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
800.flavor: When Emhyr declared that his cavalry would stomp his enemies into the mud, we thought he was speaking metaphorically. We were wrong.

801.name: Battle Preparation
801.ability: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 Armor. If it's a Soldier, boost by 6 and give 2 Armor instead.
801.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it 2 Armor. If it's a Soldier, boost by 6 and give 2 Armor instead.
801.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
801.flavor: Many a knight met an untimely death because of his shoddily tied breastplate coming undone.

802.name: Dracoturtle
802.ability:
Whenever this unit loses Armor, boost it by the amount of Armor lost.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
802.ability_html: Whenever this unit loses Armor, boost it by the amount of Armor lost. Barricade: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
802.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
802.flavor: Oxenfurt monstrologists claim the brain of a dracoturtle is the size of a peanut. Its maw, however, is the size of a wide-open gate.

803.name: Covenant of Steel
803.ability:
Defender.
Berserk 6: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
803.ability_html: Defender. Berserk 6: At the end of your turn, gain 1 Armor.
803.keyword_html: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
803.flavor: If you want to give Skelligers a laugh, tell them they're outnumbered.

804.name: Morkvarg: Heart of Terror
804.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Repeat until the target is damaged.
804.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Repeat until the target is damaged.
804.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
804.flavor: He showed no mercy, didn't respect our laws or our gods. He knew how it must end. And it still didn't stop him.

805.name: Raiding Fleet
805.ability: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (4), then play a random bronze Ship from your deck.
805.ability_html: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (4), then play a random bronze Ship from your deck.
805.keyword_html: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
805.flavor: The rocky Skellige lands, battered by cold winds, give life only to nettles and moss. But the islanders know that there is fertile soil on the other side of the sea…

806.name: Terror of the Seas
806.ability:
Zeal. Order: Lose all Armor and damage an enemy unit by that amount.
Whenever you play a Pirate, gain 1 Armor.
806.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Lose all Armor and damage an enemy unit by that amount. Whenever you play a Pirate, gain 1 Armor.
806.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
806.flavor: All it takes is a small hole for the largest ship to sink.

807.name: Armored Drakkar
807.ability:
At the end of your turn, if Armored Drakkar has no Armor, gain 2 Armor.
Exposed: Boost self by 1.
Bloodthirst 2: Boost by 2 instead.
807.ability_html: At the end of your turn, if Armored Drakkar has no Armor, gain 2 Armor. Exposed: Boost self by 1. Bloodthirst 2: Boost by 2 instead.
807.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability.
807.flavor: You can't take it upriver… but you can certainly take it to chase the imperial fleet.

808.name: Terror Crew Plunderer
808.ability: Deploy: Damage a unit by 2. If it's allied, also boost self by 4.
808.ability_html: Deploy: Damage a unit by 2. If it's allied, also boost self by 4.
808.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
808.flavor: They say diamonds are a girl's best friend. But my best friend is a knife. I can use it to get anything else I want.

809.name: Boatbuilders
809.ability:
Deploy: Give an allied unit 2 Armor. If you control a Ship, also gain Zeal.
Order: Give an allied unit 1 Armor.
Cooldown: 1
809.ability_html: Deploy: Give an allied unit 2 Armor. If you control a Ship, also gain Zeal. Order: Give an allied unit 1 Armor. Cooldown: 1
809.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
809.flavor: There's no more respected profession on the islands than boat building. The worst cutthroats bow and ask how things are going…

810.name: Terror Crew Axe-wielder
810.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Exposed: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
810.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Exposed: Damage a random enemy unit by 2.
810.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
810.flavor: But dear Skelligers, what use do you have for axes? There are no trees in the sea…

811.name: Stunning Blow
811.ability: Damage a unit by 5. If it has Armor, damage by 7 instead.
811.ability_html: Damage a unit by 5. If it has Armor, damage by 7 instead.
811.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
811.flavor: It clanged like hitting a bell. The Redanian fell to the ground unconscious, dark blood gushing from underneath the dented metal…

812.name: Zoltan: Warrior
812.ability:
Deploy: Damage 2 enemy units by 3. For each unit that survived, Spawn a Rowdy Dwarf on this row.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
812.ability_html: Deploy: Damage 2 enemy units by 3. For each unit that survived, Spawn a Rowdy Dwarf on this row. Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
812.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
812.flavor: I've decided to do tangible good, that is not wasted. I am good to myself and my immediate surroundings.

813.name: Percival Schuttenbach
813.keyword_html: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units.
813.flavor: Underneath the wet hood, instead of a billowy beard, was a long, pointed nose, clearly marking its owner as a member of the old and noble race of gnomes.

814.name: Munro Bruys
814.ability:
Zeal. Order: Transform 1 allied Rowdy Dwarf into a Dwarf Berserker.
Cooldown: 2
Barricade: Set the Cooldown to 1.
814.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Transform 1 allied Rowdy Dwarf into a Dwarf Berserker. Cooldown: 2 Barricade: Set the Cooldown to 1.
814.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
814.flavor: Munro dreamed of building steam and water-powered hammerworks. But he ended up as bouncer at the worst bar in Vizima…

815.name: Figgis Merluzzo
815.ability:
Defender.
Order: Move self to the other row.
815.ability_html: Defender. Order: Move self to the other row.
815.keyword_html: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
815.flavor: I'm a simple guy. I like drinking, eating, singing lewd songs… And when the party dies down, pissing on the dying bonfire.

816.name: Zoltan's Company
816.ability: Spawn 2 Rowdy Dwarves on an allied row. Increase the number of Spawned Rowdy Dwarves by 1 for each Zoltan in your starting deck.
816.ability_html: Spawn 2 Rowdy Dwarves on an allied row. Increase the number of Spawned Rowdy Dwarves by 1 for each Zoltan in your starting deck.
816.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
816.flavor: They'd follow each other into the fire. And laugh about it.

817.name: Dwarven Chariot
817.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 4 and gain 2 Armor.
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn 2 Rowdy Dwarves on your Melee row.
Order: Give an allied unit 1 Armor.
Cooldown: 1
817.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 4 and gain 2 Armor. Deploy (Ranged): Spawn 2 Rowdy Dwarves on your Melee row. Order: Give an allied unit 1 Armor. Cooldown: 1
817.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
817.flavor: You can draw anything you like, my dear dwarves. But you can't build it, mark my words.

818.name: Tempering
818.ability: Boost an allied unit by 5. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 Armor.
818.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 5. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 2 Armor.
818.keyword_html: Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
818.flavor: Dwarven steel is very tough. Almost as tough as the dwarves themselves.

819.name: Miner
819.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 2.
If it's a Dwarf, also give it 4 Armor.
819.ability_html: Order: Boost an allied unit by 2. If it's a Dwarf, also give it 4 Armor.
819.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
819.flavor: Which moron's whistling in the mine?!

820.name: Dryad Enchantress
820.ability:
Symbiosis.
Deploy (Melee): Give an allied unit 4 Armor.
Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (4).
820.ability_html: Symbiosis. Deploy (Melee): Give an allied unit 4 Armor. Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality (4).

Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
820.flavor: The dryads used to stay on the sidelines, avoiding the conflict between the races. But times change…

821.name: Dwarf Berserker
821.ability: Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1 then damage a random enemy unit by 1.
821.ability_html: Barricade: At the end of your turn, damage self by 1 then damage a random enemy unit by 1.
821.keyword_html: Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
821.flavor: I know I'm going to die. So I'm making sure I'll have company.

822.name: Rowdy Dwarf
822.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
822.flavor: Blech! What is this! That's piss, not beer!

823.name: Radeyah
823.ability:
If your starting deck has no duplicates,
Deploy (Melee): Spawn your faction stratagem on this row.
Deploy (Ranged): Create a Neutral stratagem on this row.
823.ability_html: If your starting deck has no duplicates, Deploy (Melee): Spawn your faction stratagem on this row. Deploy (Ranged): Create a Neutral stratagem on this row.

823.flavor: You can hide a lot behind a beautiful smile.

824.name: Maraal
824.ability:
Deploy: Poison an enemy unit.
Order (Melee): Poison an enemy unit.
824.ability_html: Deploy: Poison an enemy unit. Order (Melee): Poison an enemy unit.

Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
824.flavor: I know how to kill in a thousand and one ways.

825.name: Matta Hu'uri
825.ability: Deploy (Ranged): If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, they draw the lowest-cost card, and you draw the highest-cost card.
825.ability_html: Deploy (Ranged): If neither player has passed and your opponent's hand is not full, they draw the lowest-cost card, and you draw the highest-cost card.
825.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
825.flavor: Sorceresses use magic to hypnotize. I use dance.

826.name: Dulla kh'Amanni
826.ability: Deploy: If you control Runewright, Spawn Desert Treasure on this row.
826.ability_html: Deploy: If you control Runewright, Spawn Desert Treasure on this row.
826.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
826.flavor: To know the world is to praise god's name.

827.name: Runewright

827.ability_html: Deploy: If you control Dulla kh'Amanni, Spawn Desert Treasure on this row.
827.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
827.flavor: Great power lies in words. But it's not easy to enchant it into steel.

828.name: Saer Qu'an
828.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by the number of units you control.
828.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by the number of units you control.
828.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
828.flavor: Every tiger is dangerous. Especially one that has taken a liking to human flesh…

829.name: Caravan Vanguard
829.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Boost self by 3.
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self on this row.
Bonded: Combine both abilities instead.

829.flavor: It's not easy to find one's way among the shifting dunes…

830.name: Caravan Guard
830.ability: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Increase this damage by 1 for every 3 power the target has.
830.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 1. Increase this damage by 1 for every 3 power the target has.
830.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
830.flavor: There's a lot of ways you can die in the desert. Not just from thirst.

831.name: King Cobra
831.ability_html: Deploy: Poison an enemy unit.
831.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
831.flavor: As long as I play it'll dance. But when I stop…

832.name: Ofiri Merchant

832.ability_html: Deploy: Swap the top card of your opponent's deck with yours.
832.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
832.flavor: I have that which you desire. As well as that which you have never seen before…

833.name: Basilisk Venom
833.ability_html: Order: Poison a unit.
833.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
833.flavor: People think a basilisk kills with its eyes, but it's the colorless fumes from its venom that cause death…

834.name: Crystal Skull
834.ability: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
834.ability_html: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
834.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.

835.ability_html: Order: Boost a unit in your hand by 3 and give it 2 Armor.

835.flavor: Lean in, listen closely, and you'll hear a whisper…

836.name: Cursed Scroll
836.ability: Order: Draw a card of your choice, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
836.ability_html: Order: Draw a card of your choice, then move a card from your hand to the bottom of your deck.
836.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
836.flavor: The seal states clearly: do not open. But of course… curiosity will win out.

837.ability_html: Order: Damage an enemy unit by 3 and give it Bleeding (2).

Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
837.flavor: Decorated like a prince's coronet. Sharp like a butcher's knife.

838.name: Magic Lamp
838.ability_html: Order: Transform into Lamp Djinn.
838.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
838.flavor: It's a little tarnished. A little rubbing will make it shiny again.

839.ability_html: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Shield.
839.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit.

840.name: War Elephant
840.ability:

840.flavor: It's kind of like a fiend, but bald and with a nose that hangs to the ground. What? No, you're making things up!

841.name: Siege
841.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Siege Engine.
Prologue: Spawn a reinforced Trebuchet on your Ranged row.

841.flavor: There's no fortress that can't be taken. There are just fortresses not worth taking.

Shield.
Deploy: Spawn a base copy of self on this row.

Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
848.flavor: Time doesn't flow, it goes in circles. The past becomes the future, grandfathers repeat the mistakes of their grandsons.

849.name: In Gedyneith's Shadow
849.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Druid.
Prologue: Spawn a Crow Clan Preacher on this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn and play Crow's-eye Rhizome.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Mardroeme.

850.name: Crowmother
850.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 2 Crows on this row.
Whenever you play an Alchemy card, Summon Crowmother from your graveyard to a random allied row.

851.ability_html: Damage a unit by 1 six times or split 6 damage randomly between all units on an enemy row.
851.flavor: How much of a dose would be lethal? Any.

Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.

854.name: Crow Clan Preacher

Whenever you play an Alchemy card, boost self by 1.

854.flavor: A lot of learning awaits you. And a lot of mistakes.

855.flavor: Fatally poisonous. Unless you know how to prepare it…

856.ability_html: Deploy: Summon all copies of self from your graveyard to this row. If you have an Alchemy card in your hand, also Summon all copies from your deck.
856.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
856.flavor: The Crowmother has a thousand eyes and each one is closely watching.

857.ability_html: Order: Trigger an allied unit's Deathwish ability.

857.flavor: Everyone carries some darkness in them. Some have learned to bend it to their will…

Order: Destroy a Rat, then Poison an enemy unit.
Cooldown: 1
Deathwish: Spawn 7 Rats on this row.

Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
858.flavor: To bring down humanity, she will awaken her rats and send them to die in the happy city.

859.name: Penitent
859.ability:
Thrive.

859.ability_html: Thrive. Deathwish: Summon a random 7-provision cost unit from your deck to this row.

Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).

860.name: The Beast
860.ability: At the end of your turn, if this is not the highest-power unit on the battlefield, boost it by 2.
860.ability_html: At the end of your turn, if this is not the highest-power unit on the battlefield, boost it by 2.
860.flavor: The Beast didn't come from nowhere. You all summoned it. With your lust, your greed and your cruelty.

861.name: Haunt
861.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a unit with Deathwish.
Prologue: Spawn a Desert Banshee on this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn and play a Barghest.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play a Nightwraith.

862.name: Barghest
862.ability:
Deploy: Consume an allied unit.
Order (Dominance): Consume an allied unit.
862.ability_html: Deploy: Consume an allied unit. Order (Dominance): Consume an allied unit.

Dominance: Trigger this ability if you control the highest unit on the battlefield.

863.name: Desert Banshee

Order: Consume an allied unit.
Whenever you play a unit with the Deathwish ability, boost self by 1.

Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
863.flavor: You're worried you'll die of thirst in the sands? Relax. You won't make it that long.
