Chapter 2: Spawn and play Waylay.
870.ability_html: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Elf. Prologue: Spawn a Vernossiel's Commando on this row. Chapter 1: Spawn 2 Elven Deadeyes on this row. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Waylay.
870.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
870.flavor: In order to set a trap, you should usually hide. But… there are exceptions to this rule.

871.name: Vernossiel's Commando
871.ability:
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you control only Elf units.
Ignore the condition if you control Vernossiel.
871.ability_html:
At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if you control only Elf units.
Ignore the condition if you control Vernossiel.
871.flavor: Only a swish could be heard... Followed by six men tumbling dead to the ground.

872.name: Vrihedd Saboteur
872.ability: Deploy: If you control an artifact, Spawn an Elven Deadeye on this row.
872.ability_html: Deploy: If you control an artifact, Spawn an Elven Deadeye on this row.
872.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
872.flavor: The gates were ordered to be closed… But they didn't budge.

873.name: Nature's Rebuke
873.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 5. 
Deathblow: Boost a random allied Treant by 2.
873.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Deathblow: Boost a random allied Treant by 2.
873.keyword_html: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
873.flavor: Nature has long endured man's excesses. But even she finally ran out of patience…

874.name: Trained Hawk
874.ability:
Harmony.
Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deploy (Ranged): Move a unit to the other row.
874.ability_html: Harmony. Deploy (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deploy (Ranged): Move a unit to the other row.
874.keyword_html: Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
874.flavor: I whistle once, it comes back. I whistle twice, it comes back with your eyes in its talons.

875.name: Collar
875.ability: Order: Lock an enemy unit and damage it by 3.
875.ability_html: Order: Lock an enemy unit and damage it by 3.
875.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
875.flavor: Those who fall into debt with the Moorlehems have two options: go into slavery or kill themselves. The smart ones choose option number two.

876.name: Vincent van Moorlehem
876.ability: Deploy: Destroy an enemy unit with a status.
876.ability_html: Deploy: Destroy an enemy unit with a status.
876.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
876.flavor: Everyone gives the Moorlehems a wide berth. Even tax collectors.

877.name: Masquerade Ball
877.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Aristocrat on your side of the battlefield.
Prologue: Spawn a Thirsty Dame on this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire.
Chapter 2: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire.
877.ability_html: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play an Aristocrat on your side of the battlefield. Prologue: Spawn a Thirsty Dame on this row. Chapter 1: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire. Chapter 2: Spawn and play Fangs of the Empire.
877.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
877.flavor: Ophelie Van Moorlehem loves throwing huge galas. The fact that some attendees then disappear without a trace doesn't seem to bother anyone…

878.name: Philippe van Moorlehem
878.ability:
Deploy: If you control a Vampire, gain Zeal.
Order: Give an enemy unit Doomed. If it already has a status, Lock it instead. If it already has more than 1 status, Poison it instead.
Cooldown: 1
878.ability_html: Deploy: If you control a Vampire, gain Zeal. Order: Give an enemy unit Doomed. If it already has a status, Lock it instead. If it already has more than 1 status, Poison it instead. Cooldown: 1
878.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
878.flavor: It's said that Vincent Van Moorlehem fears only one man. It's not Emhyr var Emreis or Geralt of Rivia - it’s his own son.

879.name: Van Moorlehem's Cupbearer
879.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy (Melee): Poison a unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
879.ability_html: Assimilate. Deploy (Melee): Poison a unit. Deploy (Ranged): Purify a unit.
879.keyword_html: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Purify: Remove all statuses.
879.flavor: My specialty? Tartar. Of what? Ah, that depends on the host's mood…

880.name: Van Moorlehem Hunter
880.ability:
Deploy (Melee) Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2).
Deploy (Ranged): Lock a unit.
880.ability_html: Deploy (Melee) Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2). Deploy (Ranged): Lock a unit.
880.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
880.flavor: Rather than beasts, he prefers to stalk poachers. But they don't come as often anymore into the woods surrounding the palace…

881.name: Hunting Pack
881.ability: Deploy: If an enemy unit has a status, Summon all copies of self from your deck to this row.
881.ability_html: Deploy: If an enemy unit has a status, Summon all copies of self from your deck to this row.
881.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
881.flavor: The hounds of the Van Moorlehems have an extraordinary sense of smell - and extremely sharp teeth.

882.name: Van Moorlehem Servant
882.ability: Deploy: Copy all statuses (excluding Infused) from an enemy unit to another enemy unit. Boost self by the number of status copied that way.
882.ability_html: Deploy: Copy all statuses (excluding Infused) from an enemy unit to another enemy unit. Boost self by the number of status copied that way.
882.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Infused: Status that adds effects or categories to a card. Removing the status also removes all added effects and categories. Lock disables Infused abilities.
882.flavor: They say she's served the Moorlehems for thirty years. And she hasn't aged a day…

883.name: Thirsty Dame
883.ability: Whenever an enemy unit receives a status, boost self by 1.
883.ability_html: Whenever an enemy unit receives a status, boost self by 1.
883.flavor: My teeth are red? Oh, that's from the wine…

884.name: Tiger's Eye
884.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
884.flavor: A diamond the size of a goose egg. And worth a small country.

885.name: Collusion
885.ability:
If you control a unit with the Gang category:
Blindeyes - Increase all other effects by 1.
Crownsplitters - Boost the lowest-power allied unit by 4.
Cutups - Damage the highest-power enemy unit by 4.
Firesworn - Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealot on a random allied row.
Tidecloaks - Gain 4 Coins.
885.ability_html: If you control a unit with the Gang category: Blindeyes - Increase all other effects by 1. Crownsplitters - Boost the lowest-power allied unit by 4. Cutups - Damage the highest-power enemy unit by 4. Firesworn - Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealot on a random allied row. Tidecloaks - Gain 4 Coins.
885.keyword_html: Gang: Criminal organisations including Blindeyes, Crownsplitters, Cutups, Firesworn, Salamandra and Tidecloaks. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
885.flavor: There's enough gold in this city for everyone. Well, at least for us.

886.name: One Night at the Passiflora
886.ability:
Doomed.
Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Blindeye.
Prologue: Spawn Sly Seductress on this row.
Chapter 1: Spawn Passiflora Peaches on this row.
Chapter 2: Gain 6 Coins.
886.ability_html: Doomed. Scenario: Progress whenever you play a Blindeye. Prologue: Spawn Sly Seductress on this row. Chapter 1: Spawn Passiflora Peaches on this row. Chapter 2: Gain 6 Coins.
886.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
886.flavor: More pilgrims come here than to the Temple of the Eternal Fire…

887.name: Saul de Navarette
887.ability:
Hoard 3: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
Hoard 6: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2 instead.
Hoard 9: At the end of your turn, boost self by 3 instead.
887.ability_html: Hoard 3: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1. Hoard 6: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2 instead. Hoard 9: At the end of your turn, boost self by 3 instead.
887.keyword_html: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
887.flavor: A connoisseur with bottomless pockets and a soul black as tar.

888.name: Ludovicus Brunenbaum
888.ability:
Timer 3: Gain 9 Coins.
Tribute 5: Gain 9 Coins immediately instead.
888.ability_html: Timer 3: Gain 9 Coins. Tribute 5: Gain 9 Coins immediately instead.
888.keyword_html: Timer: Before the end of your turn, lower the number by 1. When the number reaches 0, trigger the ability. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
888.flavor: They say he'd sell his own mother. But no one was buying.

889.name: Bloody Good Friends
889.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (1). If it's boosted, damage it by 1 instead.
889.ability_html: Insanity. Fee 1: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (1). If it's boosted, damage it by 1 instead.
889.keyword_html: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
889.flavor: I'll kill you as soon as we kill them!

890.name: Street Urchins
890.ability_html: Profit 3. Fee 1: Boost self by 1.
890.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
890.flavor: When I was five, I stole candy. Now I'm six and I work in robbery.

891.name: Payroll Specialist
891.ability: Tribute 1: Move a unit to the other row.
891.ability_html: Tribute 1: Move a unit to the other row.
891.keyword_html: Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
891.flavor: Guards in Novigrad work for very little money, yet live like kings. Just another paradox of the Free City…

892.name: Passiflora Peaches
892.ability: Hoard 4: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
892.ability_html: Hoard 4: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1.
892.keyword_html: Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.
892.flavor: They'll mess with your head, break your heart and empty your purse.

893.name: Scarab
893.keyword_html: Defender: Status that prevents the opponent from targeting other cards in this row. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
893.flavor: In Zerrikania, they’re considered a symbol of resurrection. But to be born again, first you have to die.

894.name: Savolla's Frightener
894.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
894.flavor: The witchers thought the Salamandra thugs wouldn't get through Kaer Morhen's walls. The witchers were wrong.

895.name: Greater Brothers
895.ability:
Insanity.
Fee 2: Gain 2 Armor.
Exposed: Destroy self.
895.ability_html: Insanity. Fee 2: Gain 2 Armor. Exposed: Destroy self.
895.keyword_html: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Exposed: Trigger this ability whenever the unit loses its Armor.
895.flavor: A battering ram? No need, we'll handle it another way.

896.name: Lamp Djinn
896.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
896.flavor: I lived in a bottle once, but I prefer Ofiri lamps, they're much more comfortable.

897.name: Rat
897.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
897.flavor: I call the tiny one Yersinia. She's cute, isn't she?

898.name: Crow
898.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
898.flavor: When among crows, you must caw like they do.

899.name: Desert Treasure
899.ability:
Doomed.
Zeal. Order: Spawn and play a random legendary unit from any faction.
899.ability_html: Doomed. Zeal. Order: Spawn and play a random legendary unit from any faction.
899.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
899.flavor: I definitely prefer digging up treasure to burying it.

900.name: Overwhelming Hunger

Order: Destroy an allied unit, then Spawn an Ekimmara on its row and boost it by the destroyed unit's power.
Charges: 2

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

901.name: Imposter
901.ability:
Order: Lock an enemy unit, then Spawn its base copy on the opposite row and boost it by the number of enemy units with a status on the Locked unit's row.
Whenever you play an Aristocrat on your side of the battlefield, if there are at least 4 different statuses on your opponent's side of the battlefield, boost it by 1.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

This ability adds 15 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

902.name: Uprising

Order: Boost an allied unit by 1.
Charges: 3
Once per game, once all Charges are used up, Spawn and play a Lyrian Scytheman.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

903.name: Mahakam Forge

All Dwarves in your starting deck get 1 Armor.

This ability adds 18 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

904.name: Blaze of Glory
904.ability:
Order: Move a non-Neutral unit from your deck to your graveyard, then damage an enemy unit by its power.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.
904.ability_html: Order: Move a non-Neutral unit from your deck to your graveyard, then damage an enemy unit by its power. This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

905.name: Hidden Cache
905.ability:
Order: Gain 3 Coins.
At the start of the round, refresh this ability.
Your Hoards require 2 less Coins to trigger.

This ability adds 16 provisions to your deck's provision limit.

Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Hoard: Trigger this ability if you possess the specified number of Coins or more.

906.name: Master Mirror
906.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Transform the leftmost card in your hand into a random legendary card from your faction that was not in your starting deck.
Repeat this ability whenever you play the rightmost card from your hand.
906.ability_html: Veil. Deploy: Transform the leftmost card in your hand into a random legendary card from your faction that was not in your starting deck. Repeat this ability whenever you play the rightmost card from your hand.
906.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
906.flavor: Some figures prefer to always remain hidden while playing the role of shadow in the most crucial events in history. One figure especially, to be precise.

907.name: Ethereal
907.ability:
Doomed.
Deploy: Gain Zeal.
Order: Transform unit to the right into base copy of self.
907.ability_html: Doomed. Deploy: Gain Zeal. Order: Transform unit to the right into base copy of self.
907.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
907.flavor: Her worst nightmare can easily be yours too.

908.name: Oneiromancy
908.ability:
Echo.
Play any card from your deck.
908.ability_html: Echo. Play any card from your deck.
908.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed.
908.flavor: Deciphering the past and the future as they appear in dreams is very difficult, even for a master.

909.name: Siegfried of Denesle
909.ability_html: Deploy: Purify all other units.
909.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses.
909.flavor: We're on the same side, witcher. You'll realize this one day.

910.name: Allgod
910.ability:
Deploy: Boost 3 units in your deck by 2.
Increase the number of targets by 1 for each Offering in your starting deck.
910.ability_html: Deploy: Boost 3 units in your deck by 2. Increase the number of targets by 1 for each Offering in your starting deck.
910.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
910.flavor: Make your sacrifices or face divine anger! The food better be good or prepare to face my wrath nonetheless.

911.name: Marlene de Trastamara
911.ability:
Doomed.
Order: If not Doomed, gain Resilience.
911.ability_html: Doomed. Order: If not Doomed, gain Resilience.
911.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round.
911.flavor: None shall sit and dine with you at your table, no spoon you have shall sate you, never again shall you wish to spy your reflection in the mirror.

912.name: Pact
912.ability: Boost a unit by 6 and give it Doomed.
912.ability_html: Boost a unit by 6 and give it Doomed.
912.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
912.flavor: Your wishes he grants, as he swears to adore you – Gold, silver, jewels... he lays riches before you – Dues need be repaid, and he will come for you – All to reclaim, no smile to console you!

913.name: Will o' the wisp
913.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
913.flavor: Fool's fires... those little shiny thingies that shall lead thee to certain doom.

914.name: Squirrel
914.ability: Deploy: Banish a card from your opponent's graveyard.
914.ability_html: Deploy: Banish a card from your opponent's graveyard.
914.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
914.flavor: Just one badass squirrel. Nothing less, nothing more.

915.name: Offering
915.ability: Destroy a unit with 4 or less power, then boost a unit in your deck by 2.
915.ability_html: Destroy a unit with 4 or less power, then boost a unit in your deck by 2.
915.flavor: Both gods and demons alike can be appeased by a plentiful sacrifice.

916.name: Fortune Teller
916.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give Doomed to a unit.
Deploy (Ranged): Give Veil to a unit.
916.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Give Doomed to a unit. Deploy (Ranged): Give Veil to a unit.
916.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
916.flavor: Her prophecies have never been wrong – mainly because she always predicts something bad to happen.

917.name: Auberon: King
917.ability:
Deploy: Spawn and play a random bronze Wild Hunt unit.
At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
917.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn and play a random bronze Wild Hunt unit. At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
917.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
917.flavor: The end of one world can be the beginning of another.

918.name: Auberon: Invader
918.ability:
Deploy: Create and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit.
Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
918.ability_html: Deploy: Create and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit. Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
918.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
918.flavor: If they will not submit, they shall be driven out!

919.name: Auberon: Conqueror
919.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Spawn and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit from your starting deck.
Whenever you play a Wild Hunt unit, boost it by 1.
919.ability_html: Veil. Deploy: Spawn and play a bronze Wild Hunt unit from your starting deck. Whenever you play a Wild Hunt unit, boost it by 1.
919.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
919.flavor: After having lived over six hundred and fifty years, little remains to excite.

920.name: Eredin Bréacc Glas
920.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns.
Dominance: Increase the damage dealt by Frost by 1
920.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns. Dominance: Increase the damage dealt by Frost by 1
920.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2. Dominance: Trigger this ability if you control the highest unit on the battlefield.

921.name: Ard Gaeth
921.ability:
Echo.
Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 3 turns.
921.ability_html: Echo. Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 3 turns.
921.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
921.flavor: Very useful for travels to other dimensions and bringing apocalypse upon the world.

922.name: Winter Queen
922.ability:
At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on both enemy rows, Summon self from your deck to your Ranged row.
Devotion: Once both players have passed, boost self by 2 for each turn of Frost remaining on your opponent's side.
922.ability_html: At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on both enemy rows, Summon self from your deck to your Ranged row. Devotion: Once both players have passed, boost self by 2 for each turn of Frost remaining on your opponent's side.
922.keyword_html: Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
922.flavor: Truth is but a shard of ice.

923.name: The Apiarian Phantom
923.ability:
Veil.
Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3.
At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost self by 1.
923.ability_html: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost self by 1.
923.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
923.flavor: Who's a good boy? Well, surely not him.

924.name: Red Riders
924.ability:
Choose one:
Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns.
Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns, then replay a bronze Wild Hunt unit.
Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
924.ability_html: Choose one: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns. Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns, then replay a bronze Wild Hunt unit. Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
924.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
924.flavor: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

925.name: Wild Hunt Bruiser
925.ability: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row. If the target moves to a row affected by Frost, damage it by 2.
925.ability_html: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the other row. If the target moves to a row affected by Frost, damage it by 2.
925.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
925.flavor: He considers it an excellent joke - to split the skulls of the living with the skulls of the dead.

926.name: Naglfar Crew
926.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns.
At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on the opposite row, boost self by 1.
926.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 2 turns. At the end of your turn, if there is Frost on the opposite row, boost self by 1.
926.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
926.flavor: Humans don’t know what powers the Naglfar. What is the source of its magic? For those that discover the truth... Well, it’s already too late for them.

927.name: Naglfar Taskmaster
927.ability:
Deploy: Purify an enemy unit.
Dominance: Purify any unit instead.
927.ability_html: Deploy: Purify an enemy unit. Dominance: Purify any unit instead.
927.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses. Dominance: Trigger this ability if you control the highest unit on the battlefield.
927.flavor: She ensures the ship is sustained by squeezing the life essence from those insignificant human vermin.

928.name: Aen Elle Conqueror
928.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Destroy self.
Devotion: Cancel the Deploy ability.
928.ability_html: Veil. Deploy: Destroy self. Devotion: Cancel the Deploy ability.
928.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
928.flavor: For his noble kind morality is but a whim enjoyed by others. More specifically, those who lose.

929.name: Harald an Craite
929.ability:
Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard, give it Doomed and damage self by 2.
At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
929.ability_html: Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard, give it Doomed and damage self by 2. At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
929.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
929.flavor: His battle with the bear made him a different man, no doubt. But many argue if for the better.

930.name: Harald: Warmonger
930.ability:
Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
930.ability_html: Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed. Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
930.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
930.flavor: The grit of constant suffering had festered in him an unstoppable thirst for inflicting the same pain onto others.

931.name: Harald the Cripple
931.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
Whenever you play a Warrior, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
931.ability_html: Veil. Deploy: Play a bronze Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed. Whenever you play a Warrior, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
931.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
931.flavor: He did not stop until the islands were his and the head of the old jarl lay on the ground before him.

932.name: Tyrggvi Tuirseach
932.ability:
Veteran.
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Rupture.
932.ability_html: Veteran. Deploy: Give an enemy unit Rupture.
932.keyword_html: Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Rupture: At the end of owner's turn, damage this unit equal to its base power, then remove this status.
932.flavor: It’s not betrayal if you side with the winner.

933.name: Blood Eagle
933.ability:
Echo.
Damage an enemy unit by 2, then play a Warrior from your deck with a provision cost of 7 or less.
Deathblow: Play a Warrior from your deck instead.
Bloodthirst 3: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
933.ability_html: Echo. Damage an enemy unit by 2, then play a Warrior from your deck with a provision cost of 7 or less. Deathblow: Play a Warrior from your deck instead. Bloodthirst 3: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
933.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability.
933.flavor: Fly like an eagle – Let my spirit carry me – I want to fly like an eagle.

934.name: Skjordal Drummond
934.ability:
Devotion: Veteran.
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by Skjordal's base power.
934.ability_html: Devotion: Veteran. Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by Skjordal's base power.
934.keyword_html: Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards. Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
934.flavor: He believed in honor, and that became his undoing.

935.name: Herkja Drummond
935.ability:
Veil.
Zeal. Order (Melee): Split 3 damage randomly between enemy units on a row.
At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
935.ability_html: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Split 3 damage randomly between enemy units on a row. At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, damage a random enemy unit by 1.
935.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
935.flavor: Faithful to her clan and its jarl, her father – to the very end.

936.name: War of Clans
936.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Deathblow: Play a 4-provision cost Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed.
Devotion: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
936.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Deathblow: Play a 4-provision cost Warrior from your graveyard and give it Doomed. Devotion: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
936.keyword_html: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
936.flavor: Brother against brother, sister against sister. One blood that soaks up the ground.

937.name: Tuirseach Invader
937.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1.
937.flavor: Mother of four, ya sayeth? Well, then she shouldst been smarter than running 'round with an axe.

938.name: An Craite Raiders
938.ability:
Veteran.
Deploy (Bloodthirst 3): Gain Zeal.
Order: Damage a unit by 2.
938.ability_html: Veteran. Deploy (Bloodthirst 3): Gain Zeal. Order: Damage a unit by 2.
938.keyword_html: Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
938.flavor: Cabbage, really? It’s just the worst when there’s nothing good to plunder.

939.name: Drummond Villager
939.ability: Deploy: Give the unit to the right Bleeding (4), then give an enemy unit Bleeding (4).
939.ability_html: Deploy: Give the unit to the right Bleeding (4), then give an enemy unit Bleeding (4).
939.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
939.flavor: The lovely jointress, mother of four, wondrous cook, and last but not least – a fierce warrior.

940.name: Drummond Berserker
940.ability:
At the end of your turn, damage self and a random enemy unit by 1. 
Berserk 3: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
940.ability_html: At the end of your turn, damage self and a random enemy unit by 1. Berserk 3: Transform into a Bear Abomination.
940.keyword_html: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.

941.name: Jacques: Miracle Child
941.ability:
Profit 4.
Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots on this row.
At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
941.ability_html: Profit 4. Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Firesworn Zealots on this row. At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
941.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
941.flavor: As a child he loved two things: playing with his toy soldiers and a game called “Kill the Elf”.

942.name: Jacques de Aldersberg
942.ability:
Profit 4.
Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen on this row.
Fee 1: Boost self by 1.
Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
942.ability_html: Profit 4. Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen on this row. Fee 1: Boost self by 1. Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
942.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
942.flavor: His visions both terrified Jacques and made him determined to become stronger.

943.name: Jacques: Grand Master
943.ability:
Veil.
Profit 4.
Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen on this row.
Fee 1: Boost self by 1.
Whenever you play a Firesworn card, gain 1 Coin.
943.ability_html: Veil. Profit 4. Tribute 4: Spawn 2 Flaming Rose Footmen on this row. Fee 1: Boost self by 1. Whenever you play a Firesworn card, gain 1 Coin.
943.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
943.flavor: The Grand Master did not hesitate to try anything that could save everything.

944.name: Ulrich
944.ability:
Intimidate. 
Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Firesworn unit from your hand.
Devotion: Boost it by 2.
944.ability_html: Intimidate. Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of a bronze Firesworn unit from your hand. Devotion: Boost it by 2.
944.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
944.flavor: When the Order was disbanded, those who didn't join the witch hunters formed the Fallen Knights, of which Ulrich became the Grand Master.

945.name: Dies Irae
945.ability:
Echo.
Damage an enemy unit by 3 and boost all allied Firesworn units by 1.
Deathblow: Boost all allied units instead.
945.ability_html: Echo. Damage an enemy unit by 3 and boost all allied Firesworn units by 1. Deathblow: Boost all allied units instead.
945.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
945.flavor: The righteous wrath of the Eternal Fire! Justice of the Flaming Rose!

946.name: Roderick de Wett
946.ability:
Veil.
Zeal. Order (Melee): Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman on this row.
At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, gain 1 Coin.
946.ability_html: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman on this row. At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, gain 1 Coin.
946.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
946.flavor: Count de Wett is exceptionally loathsome and arrogant, but at least he enjoys a little dice poker on the side.

947.name: Lieutenant von Herst
947.ability:
At the end of your turn, if you control a Cleric, Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on this row.
Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
947.ability_html: At the end of your turn, if you control a Cleric, Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on this row. Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
947.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
947.flavor: The fall of the Order wasn’t so hard for him like for the others. He is still required to count the goods and manage supplies, only now it has become even easier… Less strict at least.

948.name: Smuggle
948.ability:
Profit 3.
Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman on an allied row.
948.ability_html: Profit 3. Spawn a Flaming Rose Footman on an allied row.
948.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
948.flavor: Whoever said that the dead are good for nothing? They make for such great smuggle-bags.

949.name: Cleric of the Flaming Rose
949.ability:
Profit 3.
Tribute 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on this row.
Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
949.ability_html: Profit 3. Tribute 2: Spawn a Firesworn Zealot on this row. Fee 1: Transform a Firesworn Zealot into a Flaming Rose Footman.
949.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
949.flavor: We have two eyes, two ears, but only one tongue, so that we would look and listen twice more than we speak.

950.name: Fallen Knight
950.ability:
Veil.
Intimidate.
Whenever you Spawn a unit on your side of the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each unit Spawned.
950.ability_html: Veil. Intimidate. Whenever you Spawn a unit on your side of the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each unit Spawned.
950.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
950.flavor: He abandoned the righteous fight and the flame in him has long gone.

951.name: Lonely Champion
951.ability:
Immunity.
Zeal. Order: Destroy all Firesworn Tokens on this row, then boost self by their total power.
Cooldown: 2
951.ability_html: Immunity. Zeal. Order: Destroy all Firesworn Tokens on this row, then boost self by their total power. Cooldown: 2
951.keyword_html: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
951.flavor: So long as he continues the righteous fight, the Order and its flame endure.

952.name: Mutants Maker
952.ability:
Deploy: Destroy an allied unit, then gain 3 Coins.
Devotion: Gain 3 Coins instead.
952.ability_html: Deploy: Destroy an allied unit, then gain 3 Coins. Devotion: Gain 3 Coins instead.
952.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
952.flavor: I’m a scientist, truly. I can’t help it if the Oxenfurt professors were just too narrow-sighted to appreciate my particular research methods.

953.name: Flaming Rose Footman
953.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
953.flavor: Anyone can join The Order – a knight, a peasant, even a witcher.

954.name: Viraxas: Prince
954.ability:
Order: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's Order ability.
At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
954.ability_html: Order: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's Order ability. At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
954.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
954.flavor: Parents often envy their children's strength and vigor. And children rarely notice it.

955.name: Viraxas: Outcast
955.ability:
Formation.
Order: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's Order ability and give it Zeal.
Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
955.ability_html: Formation. Order: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's Order ability and give it Zeal. Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
955.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
955.flavor: He was banished just for being what Belohun couldn’t be anymore: young, vital, and strong.

956.name: Viraxas: King
956.ability:
Veil.
Formation.
Order: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's Order ability and give it Zeal.
Whenever you play a Soldier, boost it by 1.
956.ability_html: Veil. Formation. Order: Reset an allied non-Neutral unit's Order ability and give it Zeal. Whenever you play a Soldier, boost it by 1.
956.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
956.flavor: Revenge is a dish that tastes best when served for two.

957.name: Ildiko
957.ability:
Order: Boost an allied unit by 4.
Whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, give it Zeal.
957.ability_html: Order: Boost an allied unit by 4. Whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, give it Zeal.
957.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
957.flavor: The necklace was Ildiko’s gift to king Belohun in honor of their impending marriage. By choking the old fool, it solved that problem quite nicely.

958.name: Amphibious Assault
958.ability:
Echo.
Play a non-Neutral unit from your deck with a provision cost of 9 or less. Boost it by 1 for each provision below the limit.
958.ability_html: Echo. Play a non-Neutral unit from your deck with a provision cost of 9 or less. Boost it by 1 for each provision below the limit.
958.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed.
958.flavor: One ship here, one ship there, and the kingdom will be ours!

959.name: King Belohun
959.ability:
Whenever you play a unit with power less than 5, set its power to 5.
Devotion: Increase the power limit to 6.
959.ability_html: Whenever you play a unit with power less than 5, set its power to 5. Devotion: Increase the power limit to 6.
959.keyword_html: Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
959.flavor: The king, quite rightly, didn’t trust anyone. He also didn’t believe anybody capable of outsmarting him. This proved a fatal assumption.

960.name: Egmund
960.ability:
Veil.
Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3.
At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost the unit to the right by 1.
960.ability_html: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost the unit to the right by 1.
960.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
960.flavor: Since father has never appreciated nor trusted Egmund, it was but a simple decision to betray him.

961.name: Smoke Them Out!
961.ability: Spawn 2 Volunteers on an allied row. If you control a boosted unit, also boost Spawned Volunteers by 1.
961.ability_html: Spawn 2 Volunteers on an allied row. If you control a boosted unit, also boost Spawned Volunteers by 1.
961.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
961.flavor: Fight fire with fire, fight people with fire, fight non-humans with fire... Basically it’s best to fight everything with fire!

962.name: Kerack Frigate
962.ability:
Resupply.
Order: Spawn a Volunteer on this row.
Cooldown: 2
Crew: Set the Cooldown to 1.

Crew: Trigger this ability if this unit is between two Soldiers.
962.flavor: “I should buy a boat”, said a Kerackian cat once. Or so claims the drunken ballad.

963.name: Kerack City Guard
963.ability:
Veil.
Order: Move an enemy unit to the other row.
At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost self by 1.
963.ability_html: Veil. Order: Move an enemy unit to the other row. At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost self by 1.
963.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
963.flavor: Geralt thought there were no ugly women, but in the guardhouse of Kerack he felt compelled to revise this view.

964.name: Kerack Marine
964.ability:
Zeal. Order: Boost an allied unit by 2.
Devotion: Boost by 4 instead.
964.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Boost an allied unit by 2. Devotion: Boost by 4 instead.
964.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
964.flavor: I spy with my little eye something that is… green. Oh, shite! That’s a dryad!

965.name: Kerack Cutthroat
965.ability:
Formation.
Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
965.ability_html: Formation. Order: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (3).
965.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
965.flavor: He massacred that poor dryad’s body to the point that even her own mother would no longer be able to recognize it.

966.name: Volunteer
966.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
966.flavor: For joining the army you shall receive no greater reward than the glory of the battle itself. And gold. Gold is great too.

967.name: Usurper: Officer
967.ability:
Deploy: Spawn an Operative on an enemy row and give it Spying.
Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives.
At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
967.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn an Operative on an enemy row and give it Spying. Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives. At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
967.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
967.flavor: He was an ordinary soldier until his mind was open to the madness around him.

968.name: Usurper: General
968.ability:
Deploy: Spawn an Operative on each enemy row and give them Spying.
Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives.
Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
968.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn an Operative on each enemy row and give them Spying. Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives. Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
968.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
968.flavor: The general had a great talent for transforming idiotic orders into brilliantly executed maneuvers.

969.name: Usurper: Emperor
969.ability:
Veil.
Deploy: Spawn an Operative on each enemy row and give them Spying.
Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives.
Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, boost self by 1.
969.ability_html: Veil. Deploy: Spawn an Operative on each enemy row and give them Spying. Zeal. Order: Seize all Spying Operatives. Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, boost self by 1.
969.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead.
969.flavor: There were but two options: wash the blood born of foolish orders or wash the blood of the fool himself. A simple decision really.

970.name: Braathens
970.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy: Create and play a bronze Disloyal unit from your starting deck.
970.ability_html: Assimilate. Deploy: Create and play a bronze Disloyal unit from your starting deck.
970.keyword_html: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source. Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying.
970.flavor: His name sounded so similar to “urchin” in Nilfgaardian that Braathens decided to turn him into one. Years later Emhyr paid the mage back in kind. Braathens sounds just like “fried” after all.

971.name: Coup de Grâce
971.ability:
Echo.
Damage an enemy unit by 3.
Deathblow: Spawn and play a base copy of it.
Conspiracy: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
971.ability_html: Echo. Damage an enemy unit by 3. Deathblow: Spawn and play a base copy of it. Conspiracy: Always trigger the Deathblow ability.
971.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Conspiracy: Trigger this ability if target unit has Spying status.
971.flavor: Sometimes death is but a simple act of mercy.

972.name: Fergus var Emreis
972.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.
Devotion: Give 3 enemy units Spying instead.
972.ability_html: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying. Devotion: Give 3 enemy units Spying instead.
972.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
972.flavor: Usurper demanded that the fallen emperor grant legitimacy to the coup, and when Fergus refused, his 13-year-old son, Emhyr, was tortured. But that changed nothing.

973.name: Urcheon of Erlenwald
973.ability:
Veil.
Zeal. Order (Melee): Transform self into Duny.
At the end of your turn, boost a random allied unit by 1.
973.ability_html: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Transform self into Duny. At the end of your turn, boost a random allied unit by 1.
973.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
973.flavor: This is how I look, which you well knew, Calanthe. King Roegner, in telling you of the oath, would not have omitted such a detail in his tale.

974.name: Duny
974.ability:
Immunity.
When entering the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each Spying enemy unit.
974.ability_html: Immunity. When entering the battlefield, boost self by 1 for each Spying enemy unit.
974.keyword_html: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
974.flavor: After the curse was lifted Duny claimed ignorance regarding its origin, or who was responsible. He was lying, of course.

975.name: Amnesty
975.ability:
Seize an enemy unit with 3 or less power.
Conspiracy: Also boost it by 2.
Devotion: Always trigger the Conspiracy ability.
975.ability_html: Seize an enemy unit with 3 or less power. Conspiracy: Also boost it by 2. Devotion: Always trigger the Conspiracy ability.
975.keyword_html: Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Conspiracy: Trigger this ability if target unit has Spying status. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
975.flavor: You did what to who? To be fair, I can’t even recall the specifics anymore.

976.name: Mage Torturer
976.ability:
Veil.
Assimilate.
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.
976.ability_html: Veil. Assimilate. Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.
976.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.

977.name: Seditious Aristocrats
977.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Spying enemy unit.
Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, boost self by 1.
977.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Spying enemy unit. Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, boost self by 1.
977.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
977.flavor: They love expensive wine, horse riding, and good old backstabbing.

978.name: Mage Infiltrator
978.ability:
Disloyal.
Deploy: Damage adjacent units by 3.
Deathblow: Move self to the opposite row and remove Spying.
978.ability_html: Disloyal. Deploy: Damage adjacent units by 3. Deathblow: Move self to the opposite row and remove Spying.
978.keyword_html: Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
978.flavor: In her spare time, she likes playing practical jokes on others. Her favorite gag is switching footwraps and headwear.

979.name: Angry Mob
979.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Conspiracy: Boost self by 2.
979.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Conspiracy: Boost self by 2.
979.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Conspiracy: Trigger this ability if target unit has Spying status.
979.flavor: Wanna know their secret? They are always angry.

980.name: Operative
980.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
980.flavor: The tricky part isn’t getting on the roof. It’s how to get down without killing yourself.

981.name: Eithné: Young Queen
981.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Young Dryad on this row.
At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
981.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn a Young Dryad on this row. At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
981.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
981.flavor: She used to instruct her Dryads to warn people two or even three times before shooting with lethal intention. Used to anyhow.

982.name: Eithné: Mother
982.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 2 Young Dryads on this row.
Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
982.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn 2 Young Dryads on this row. Devotion: At the start of the round, while in hand or deck, evolve.
982.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
982.flavor: The queen wanted to protect that which was most important - Brokilon and its children. However, it’s sometimes impossible to save everyone.

983.name: Eithné: Wrath of Brokilon
983.keyword_html: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant on a random allied row and set its power equal to number of Symbioses you control.
983.flavor: After the Battle of the Ribbon, Morénn's body was so massacred that even Silver-Eyed could not recognize her own daughter.

984.name: Forest Protector
984.ability: Deploy: Play a bronze Nature card from your graveyard.
984.ability_html: Deploy: Play a bronze Nature card from your graveyard.
984.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
984.flavor: You know today is not your day when you go searching for firewood but the wood ends up seeing you as good fertilizer instead.

985.name: Shaping Nature
985.ability:
Echo.
Choose one:
Boost an allied unit by 7 and give it Veil.
Boost an allied unit by 9.
Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Vitality (6).
985.ability_html: Echo. Choose one: Boost an allied unit by 7 and give it Veil. Boost an allied unit by 9. Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Vitality (6).
985.keyword_html: Echo: At the beginning of the round, move this card from the graveyard to the top of its owner's deck. Give it Doomed. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
985.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

986.name: Freixenet
986.ability:
Zeal. Order (Ranged): Spawn a Young Dryad on this row.
Cooldown: 4
Devotion: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cooldown by the duration of Vitality on self.
986.ability_html: Zeal. Order (Ranged): Spawn a Young Dryad on this row. Cooldown: 4 Devotion: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cooldown by the duration of Vitality on self.
986.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
986.flavor: He was only meant to be a breeding stud to her. But in the end, they fell in love regardless.

987.name: Dunca
987.ability:
Veil.
Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. 
At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost a random non-Neutral unit in your hand by 1.
987.ability_html: Veil. Zeal. Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 3. At the end of your turn, if the Order is not used, boost a random non-Neutral unit in your hand by 1.
987.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row.
987.flavor: She does no warning shot, always aims to kill. No mercy, even for the little ones.

988.name: Circle of Life
988.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 3, then boost a random non-Neutral unit in your hand by 2.
Deathblow: Boost a non-Neutral unit in your hand instead.
988.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 3, then boost a random non-Neutral unit in your hand by 2. Deathblow: Boost a non-Neutral unit in your hand instead.
988.keyword_html: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit.
988.flavor: Those who want to destroy Brokilon, who try to burn its trees and kill all the living things in it, will soon enough become nourishment for its soil.

989.name: Hamadryad
989.ability:
Symbiosis.
At the end of your turn, if this unit has Vitality, boost self by 1.
989.ability_html: Symbiosis. At the end of your turn, if this unit has Vitality, boost self by 1.
989.keyword_html: Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant on a random allied row and set its power equal to number of Symbioses you control. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
989.flavor: Hamadryads form a deep life-long bond with their tree – and its squirrels, of course.

990.name: Duén Canell Guardian
990.ability:
Veil.
Symbiosis.
Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
990.ability_html: Veil. Symbiosis. Order: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
990.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant on a random allied row and set its power equal to number of Symbioses you control. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
990.flavor: You have conquered the world, d'hoine, you are everywhere, everywhere you bring with you what you call progress. But we don't want you or your progress here.

991.name: Oakcritters
991.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding (4).
Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self on this row.
Devotion: Combine both abilities instead.
991.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding (4). Deploy (Ranged): Spawn a base copy of self on this row. Devotion: Combine both abilities instead.
991.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
991.flavor: They especially like to chew on fingers, which to them are just like juicy carrots.

992.name: Abandoned Girl
992.ability: Order: Transform into a Young Dryad without changing power, then gain Vitality equal to the number of Dryads on this row.
992.ability_html: Order: Transform into a Young Dryad without changing power, then gain Vitality equal to the number of Dryads on this row.
992.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
992.flavor: People believe that sick girls will spread their illness among the dryads, but in reality, Brokilon protects its children. Abandoned ones, too.

993.name: Young Dryad
993.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Symbiosis: Whenever you play a Nature card, Spawn a Wandering Treant on a random allied row and set its power equal to number of Symbioses you control.
993.flavor: She can share her arrows with you, but not her apple.

994.name: Wandering Treant
994.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
994.flavor: I’m not wandering around, I’m roaming! Can’t you see the difference?

995.name: Shaping Nature: Veil
995.ability: Boost an allied unit by 7 and give it Veil.
995.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 7 and give it Veil.
995.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
995.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

996.name: Shaping Nature: Boost
996.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

997.name: Shaping Nature: Vitality
997.ability: Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Vitality (6).
997.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 6 and give it Vitality (6).
997.keyword_html: Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
997.flavor: You talk to me of kings and princes. Who are they? Those whom I know are white skeletons lying in the necropolises of Craag An, deep in the forest.

998.name: Red Riders: Precision
998.ability: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns.
998.ability_html: Spawn Frost on an enemy row for 4 turns.
998.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
998.flavor: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

999.name: Red Riders: Spread
999.ability: Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
999.ability_html: Spawn Frost on both enemy rows for 2 turns.
999.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Frost: At the start of the owner's turn, damage the highest power unit in this row by 2.
999.flavor: They paint the sky with snow and the earth with fire.

1000.name: Dana Méadbh
1000.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Harmony: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a non-Neutral unit, whose primary category is unique among all of your units.
1000.flavor: And thus she reveals herself, the Fairhaired Lady, adorned in flowers full. All life, both plant and beast, follows closely her step, clinging in earnest to her being.

1001.name: Woodland Spirit
1001.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
1001.flavor: We never hunt in these woods. Not even if it means the whole village'll starve.

1002.name: Morvran Voorhis
1002.ability:
Doomed.
Deploy: Draw up to 3 cards, then move the same number of cards back to the top of your deck.
1002.ability_html: Doomed. Deploy: Draw up to 3 cards, then move the same number of cards back to the top of your deck.
1002.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1002.flavor: The summer sun reflected in the quiet waters of the Alba – that's Nilfgaard to me.

1003.name: Alzur
1003.ability:
Whenever you play a Spell, Spawn a random unit with the same provision cost on this row.
Counter: 3
1003.ability_html: Whenever you play a Spell, Spawn a random unit with the same provision cost on this row. Counter: 3
1003.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1003.flavor: A rebel… outcast... knight… even sorcerer if you can believe that.

1004.name: Snowdrop
1004.ability:
Zeal. Order: Draw up to 2 cards, then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck.
Whenever you draw a card, boost self by 2.
1004.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Draw up to 2 cards, then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck. Whenever you draw a card, boost self by 2.
1004.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1004.flavor: There’s more to life than song and dance, probably...

1005.name: Cosimo Malaspina
1005.ability: Deploy: Transform adjacent units into random units that cost 1 provision more.
1005.ability_html: Deploy: Transform adjacent units into random units that cost 1 provision more.
1005.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1005.flavor: Children keep asking him for gifts. He doesn’t know why, but it really helps with finding subjects for his experiments.

1006.name: Idarran of Ulivo
1006.ability: The first time you Spawn a unit on your side of the battlefield each turn, Spawn a 1-power copy of it on this row, then give it Doomed.
1006.ability_html: The first time you Spawn a unit on your side of the battlefield each turn, Spawn a 1-power copy of it on this row, then give it Doomed.
1006.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
1006.flavor: They say beauty is in the eye of the beholder, but no one wants to see what Idarran considers beautiful...

1007.name: Geralt: Quen
1007.ability:
Shield. 
Deploy: Play a Witcher from your deck.
Adrenaline 4: Also give it a Shield.
1007.ability_html: Shield. Deploy: Play a Witcher from your deck. Adrenaline 4: Also give it a Shield.
1007.keyword_html: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1007.flavor: Geralt, feeling the iron taste of blood in his mouth, shouted a spell, throwing his hand out in front of him with his fingers open in the Quen Sign.

1008.name: Selective Mutation
1008.ability: Draw a card with Adrenaline of your choice, then shuffle a card from your hand back into your deck. Spawn a Witcher Student on each allied row.
1008.ability_html: Draw a card with Adrenaline of your choice, then shuffle a card from your hand back into your deck. Spawn a Witcher Student on each allied row.
1008.keyword_html: Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1008.flavor: We can destroy what we have created, but we cannot uncreate it.

1009.name: Triangle Within a Triangle
1009.ability: Boost an allied unit by its provision cost, or damage an enemy unit by its provision cost.
1009.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by its provision cost, or damage an enemy unit by its provision cost.
1009.flavor: Adepts of magic often confuse it with a pentacle, which can lead to an infernal disaster.

1010.name: Berengar
1010.ability: At the start of your turn, if there are no allied Witchers on this row, destroy self.
1010.ability_html: At the start of your turn, if there are no allied Witchers on this row, destroy self.
1010.flavor: Talking the vodyanoi out of sacrificing the prize-winning cow wasn’t an easy task.

1011.name: Leo
1011.ability: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Witcher you control.
1011.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each Witcher you control.
1011.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1011.flavor: He would have caught the arrow if he only had some heads-up.

1012.name: Maxii van Dekkar
1012.ability: Deploy: Look at your deck in order from top to bottom. You may shuffle your deck, then move a card to the bottom of it.
1012.ability_html: Deploy: Look at your deck in order from top to bottom. You may shuffle your deck, then move a card to the bottom of it.
1012.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1012.flavor: Magic doesn’t work on her, as she is a proud daughter of the Black Sun—and a bounty hunter that has her eyes on some very powerful sorcerers.
