1013.name: Witcher Student
1013.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
1013.flavor: Four out of ten boys survive… at most.

1015.name: Blue Mutagen
1015.ability: Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins.
1015.ability_html: Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins.
1015.keyword_html: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.

1016.name: Green Mutagen
1016.ability: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
1016.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
1016.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
1016.flavor: I’ve a green mutagen for you.

1017.name: Ivar Evil-Eye
1017.ability:
Deploy: Swap this unit's power with an enemy unit.
Adrenaline 2: Damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
1017.ability_html: Deploy: Swap this unit's power with an enemy unit. Adrenaline 2: Damage an enemy unit by 4 instead.
1017.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1017.flavor: There’s a terrible tale behind each and every scar⁠—you’d be surprised just how many are true.

1018.name: Vypper
1018.ability:
At the end of the round, move self to your opponent's graveyard. 
At the end of your turn, while in the graveyard, Banish the lowest-cost card from it.
If Vypper is the only card in the graveyard, give it Doomed and Spying, then Summon self to a random enemy row.
1018.ability_html: At the end of the round, move self to your opponent's graveyard. At the end of your turn, while in the graveyard, Banish the lowest-cost card from it. If Vypper is the only card in the graveyard, give it Doomed and Spying, then Summon self to a random enemy row.
1018.keyword_html: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
1018.flavor: Vicious, cunning. Known to wait patiently for hours before striking their prey. Once it uncoils to strike, there is no escape. Death is inevitable. ⁠— Ivar Evil-Eye

1019.name: Gorthur Gvaed
1019.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play a Viper Witcher Adept, Viper Witcher, Viper Witcher Mentor, or Viper Witcher Alchemist.
Order: Move a card from your opponent's graveyard to the top of their deck.
1019.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play a Viper Witcher Adept, Viper Witcher, Viper Witcher Mentor, or Viper Witcher Alchemist. Order: Move a card from your opponent's graveyard to the top of their deck.
1019.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1019.flavor: There were many scrolls and manuscripts about the legend of the Wild Hunt in the stronghold—and for a good reason.

1020.name: Kolgrim
1020.ability: Adrenaline 1: At the end of your turn, boost self by the difference between the number of cards in the players' decks.
1020.ability_html: Adrenaline 1: At the end of your turn, boost self by the difference between the number of cards in the players' decks.
1020.keyword_html: Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1020.flavor: Fortune only smiled upon him if it was accompanied by a stroke of very bad luck.

1021.name: Warritt the All-Seeing
1021.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Move the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck to the top of it.
Deploy (Ranged): Move the lowest-cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it.
1021.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Move the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck to the top of it. Deploy (Ranged): Move the lowest-cost card in your opponent's deck on the top of it.
1021.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
1021.flavor: By slightly modifying the Supirre sign, Warritt gained the ability to see... everything.

1022.name: Viper Witcher
1022.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2).
Adrenaline 6: If it's not a Token, Spawn a base copy of that unit at the top of your opponent's deck.
1022.ability_html: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (2). Adrenaline 6: If it's not a Token, Spawn a base copy of that unit at the top of your opponent's deck.
1022.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1022.flavor: Viper Witchers are trained to fight with twin blades, often referred to as “fangs”. This style focuses on fast and furious strikes aimed to overwhelm their target, be it monster or man.

1023.name: Viper Witcher Mentor
1023.ability:
Deploy: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the top card in your opponent's deck.
Adrenaline 2: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck instead.
1023.ability_html: Deploy: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the top card in your opponent's deck. Adrenaline 2: Set the power of this card to match the provision cost of the highest-cost card in your opponent's deck instead.
1023.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1023.flavor: Viper mentors are especially cold and ruthless in order to prepare their students for the harsh life that awaits them.

1024.name: Viper Witcher Alchemist
1024.ability: Deploy (Melee): Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
1024.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Reveal a random unit from your opponent's deck and boost self by its power.
1024.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Reveal: Show a card to both players, then hide it back in the hand or deck.
1024.flavor: What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger. Or weaker. It depends, really.

1025.name: Viper Witcher Adept
1025.ability: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if your opponent has more cards in the deck than you.
1025.ability_html: At the end of your turn, boost self by 1 if your opponent has more cards in the deck than you.
1025.flavor: Each student is given a pet to raise during their stay at Gorthur Gvaed, in order to form a strong emotional bond throughout their training. Years later, before becoming a fully-fledged witcher, they are ordered to slaughter their companion in cold blood.

1026.name: Coated Weapons
1026.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 5.
Deathblow: If it wasn't a Token, Banish it and Spawn a base copy of it on top of opponent's deck.
1026.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 5. Deathblow: If it wasn't a Token, Banish it and Spawn a base copy of it on top of opponent's deck.
1026.keyword_html: Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1026.flavor: No need to strike deep when but a scratch will prove fatal.

1027.name: Gezras of Leyda
1027.ability:
Melee: At the end of your turn, move self to the Ranged row and boost a random allied unit on this row by 1.
Ranged: At the end of your turn, move self to the Melee row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Instead of a random unit, affect all other units on that row instead.
1027.ability_html: Melee: At the end of your turn, move self to the Ranged row and boost a random allied unit on this row by 1. Ranged: At the end of your turn, move self to the Melee row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1. Adrenaline 3: Instead of a random unit, affect all other units on that row instead.
1027.keyword_html: Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1027.flavor: “Take a contract from Aen Seidhe over a dh'oine any day, as you’re far less likely to receive a knife between the ribs in place of coin.” ⁠— Gezras

1028.name: Saber-Tooth Tiger
1028.ability: Zeal. Order: Transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth.
1028.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth.
1028.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1028.flavor: The prized possession of a royal menagerie, until a commando of Scoia'tael assaulted the exhibition, released the beast, and set it upon its cruel masters. Since that day, it has acquired a selective taste for human flesh.

1029.name: Stygga Castle
1029.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play a Cat Witcher Adept, Cat Witcher, Cat Witcher Mentor, or Cat Witcher Saboteur.
Order: Move 3 allied units to the other row.
1029.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play a Cat Witcher Adept, Cat Witcher, Cat Witcher Mentor, or Cat Witcher Saboteur. Order: Move 3 allied units to the other row.
1029.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1029.flavor: The Feline witchers did not stay in Stygga Castle for long. Nor anywhere else, actually.

1030.name: Brehen
1030.ability:
Deploy: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 5 units.
Adrenaline 3: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 3 units instead.
1030.ability_html: Deploy: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 5 units. Adrenaline 3: Destroy the rightmost unit on an enemy row with at least 3 units instead.
1030.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1030.flavor: Known as the Cat of Iello. A moniker earned not from origins, but as a result of slaughtering peasants there. More of a massacre, really.

1031.name: Gaetan
1031.ability: Deploy: Move all other cards from this row to the other row. Damage a random enemy unit for each card moved by 1.
1031.ability_html: Deploy: Move all other cards from this row to the other row. Damage a random enemy unit for each card moved by 1.
1031.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1031.flavor: “Murder me just to save few crowns? I’m supposed to protect whoresons like that?” ⁠— Gaetan

1032.name: Cat Witcher
1032.ability:
At the end of your turn, move self to the other row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Damage it by 2 instead.
1032.ability_html: At the end of your turn, move self to the other row and damage a random enemy unit on the opposite row by 1. Adrenaline 3: Damage it by 2 instead.
1032.keyword_html: Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1032.flavor: Members of the School of the Cat are ill-famed due to their penchant for frenzy and bloodlust in the heat of battle. Even when their enemies capitulate, beg for mercy... Cats never stop killing.

1033.name: Cat Witcher Mentor
1033.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by the number of other cards on this row. 
Adrenaline 4: Whenever a card enters this row, boost self by 1.
1033.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by the number of other cards on this row. Adrenaline 4: Whenever a card enters this row, boost self by 1.
1033.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1033.flavor: If you fall, it’s over. Your nine lives are up, kid.

1034.name: Cat Witcher Saboteur
1034.ability: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the leftmost position on its row and damage it by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each card it passed.
1034.ability_html: Deploy: Move an enemy unit to the leftmost position on its row and damage it by 1. Increase the damage by 1 for each card it passed.
1034.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1034.flavor: “Needless to say, the ill fame of their deeds hangs like a dark cloud over our reputation to this day.” ⁠— Vesemir

1035.name: Cat Witcher Adept
1035.ability:
Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
1035.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): Give an enemy unit Bleeding equal to the number of units on that unit's row. Deploy (Ranged): Give an allied unit Vitality equal to the number of units on that unit's row.
1035.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Vitality: Status that boosts this unit by 1 on its turn end. Note: Vitality turns can accumulate; 1 turn of Vitality cancels out 1 turn of Bleeding.
1035.flavor: Cat students hone their balance by walking a tightrope blindfolded. Failure is easy to shrug off at first, but throughout their training, the walk gets higher⁠—and more perilous⁠—as they work toward their final Trial, where failure is not so forgiving.

1036.name: Making a Bomb
1036.ability: Move an enemy unit to the other row and give it Bleeding (4). If it's the only unit on that row, damage it by 4 instead.
1036.ability_html: Move an enemy unit to the other row and give it Bleeding (4). If it's the only unit on that row, damage it by 4 instead.
1036.keyword_html: Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor.
1036.flavor: You’ll probably want to follow the instructions…

1037.name: Arnaghad
1037.ability:
Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for each damaged unit.
Adrenaline 4: Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, it Clashes with Arnaghad.
1037.ability_html: Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for each damaged unit. Adrenaline 4: Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, it Clashes with Arnaghad.
1037.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Clash: Units simultanously damage each other by their power.
1037.flavor: “A witcher’s job is to kill monsters and collect coin. No more, no less.” ⁠— Arnaghad

1038.name: Dire Bear
1038.ability:
Units on this row and the opposite row can't be boosted.
Berserk 7: Affects only the opposite row.
1038.ability_html: Units on this row and the opposite row can't be boosted. Berserk 7: Affects only the opposite row.
1038.keyword_html: Berserk: Trigger this ability whenever power is equal to or lower than the specified amount.
1038.flavor: After countless attempts to slay the savage beast, one could now easily consider it… a mobile armory.

1039.name: Haern Caduch
1039.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play a Bear Witcher Adept, Bear Witcher, Bear Witcher Mentor, or Bear Witcher Quartermaster.
Order: Heal the adjacent units by 2.
1039.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play a Bear Witcher Adept, Bear Witcher, Bear Witcher Mentor, or Bear Witcher Quartermaster. Order: Heal the adjacent units by 2.
1039.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified.
1039.flavor: Carved into the icy rock of the Amell Mountains, hidden amid jagged crags and snowdrifts, the location of the long-abandoned School of the Bear remains a well-kept secret.

1040.name: Gerd
1040.ability:
Deploy: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage all units on that row by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage it by 1 instead.
1040.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage all units on that row by 1. Adrenaline 3: Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row and damage it by 1 instead.
1040.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1040.flavor: He was contracted to slay a dragon, a siren, and a striga. He was also being pursued by a vengeful knight, bounty hunters, and bandits. Despite all this, he still found time for a round of Gwent.

1041.name: Junod of Belhaven
1041.ability: Deploy: Destroy a damaged enemy unit.
1041.ability_html: Deploy: Destroy a damaged enemy unit.
1041.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1041.flavor: Rumour has it he was born of an unusual love between a lady giant and one VERY brave dwarf.

1042.name: Bear Witcher
1042.ability:
Deploy: Damage self by 3.
Adrenaline 4: Damage self and an enemy unit by 3 instead.
1042.ability_html: Deploy: Damage self by 3. Adrenaline 4: Damage self and an enemy unit by 3 instead.
1042.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1042.flavor: Life alone on the road can be tough⁠—be sure to bring all the bare necessities.

1043.name: Bear Witcher Mentor
1043.ability:
Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each damaged allied unit.
Adrenaline 3: Boost self by 1 for each damaged unit instead.
1043.ability_html: Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each damaged allied unit. Adrenaline 3: Boost self by 1 for each damaged unit instead.
1043.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1043.flavor: If you’re unsure of the way, just keep a lookout for markers⁠—the frozen corpses of would-be witchers.

1044.name: Bear Witcher Quartermaster
1044.ability:
Zeal. Order: Damage an allied unit by 1, then Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
Charges: 2
1044.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Damage an allied unit by 1, then Spawn a Witcher Student on this row. Charges: 2
1044.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges.
1044.flavor: Supply him with enough Mahakam mead, and he might just tell you a tale of how a bear took his shield and arm too!

1045.name: Bear Witcher Adept
1045.ability:
Deploy: Damage self by 4.
At the end of your turn, Heal self by 1. While not damaged, gain 1 Armor instead.
1045.ability_html: Deploy: Damage self by 4. At the end of your turn, Heal self by 1. While not damaged, gain 1 Armor instead.
1045.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Heal: If a unit's current power is lower than its base power, restore it either to base power or by the amount specified. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1045.flavor: To become a Bear Witcher, all students must pass the Trial of the Mountain. This requires venturing to the peak of Mount Gorgon to retrieve a special runestone as proof of ascent—an especially brutal challenge, as many boys freeze to death long before they find the summit.

1046.name: Armor Up
1046.ability:
Damage an enemy unit by 2.
Spawn 3 Witcher Students on the opposite row, damage them by 1, then give them 1 Armor.
1046.ability_html: Damage an enemy unit by 2. Spawn 3 Witcher Students on the opposite row, damage them by 1, then give them 1 Armor.
1046.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1046.flavor: Why try to sidestep the blow, when you can easily bear the brunt?

1047.name: Erland of Larvik
1047.ability:
Deploy: Boost all units in your deck by 1.
Adrenaline 3: Also gain Immunity.
Order: Remove boosts from all units in your deck, then boost this unit by the same amount.
1047.ability_html: Deploy: Boost all units in your deck by 1. Adrenaline 3: Also gain Immunity. Order: Remove boosts from all units in your deck, then boost this unit by the same amount.
1047.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1047.flavor: Erland founded the School of the Griffin, and hoped his emphasis on knightly values would help elevate the reputation of witchers among the common folk. Alas, his efforts would go in vain.

1048.name: Archgriffin
1048.ability: At the end of the round, shuffle this card back into your deck, keeping its boost.
1048.ability_html: At the end of the round, shuffle this card back into your deck, keeping its boost.
1048.flavor: Considered the embodiment of courage, loyalty and fighting spirit, the very essence of what Griffin Witchers are known for. However, the School of the Griffin was actually named after a knight errant known as Gryphon, who had long ago instilled these values into its founder.

1049.name: Kaer Seren
1049.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play a Griffin Witcher Adept, Griffin Witcher, Griffin Witcher Mentor, or Griffin Witcher Ranger.
Order: Boost a unit in your deck by 3.
1049.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play a Griffin Witcher Adept, Griffin Witcher, Griffin Witcher Mentor, or Griffin Witcher Ranger. Order: Boost a unit in your deck by 3.
1049.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1049.flavor: Kaer Seren’s literary collection was its greatest treasure and the envy of a group of overzealous mages. In their attempt to seize it for themselves, they destroyed the very thing they desired most.

1050.name: Coën
1050.ability: Zeal. Order: Boost all allied units with power equal to Coën by the amount of boost on Coën.
1050.ability_html: Zeal. Order: Boost all allied units with power equal to Coën by the amount of boost on Coën.
1050.keyword_html: Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1050.flavor: “There is no such thing as a fair fight. Every advantage and every opportunity that arises is used in combat.” ⁠— Coën

1051.name: Keldar
1051.ability:
Whenever you play a special card, Spawn a Witcher Student on this row. 
Adrenaline 4: At the end of your turn, Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
1051.ability_html: Whenever you play a special card, Spawn a Witcher Student on this row. Adrenaline 4: At the end of your turn, Spawn a Witcher Student on this row.
1051.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1051.flavor: “You blunt, brainless humanoids! What do you mean by ‘I don't know?’. You would go hunt the vampires with the Lebioda idol, smeared in garlic!” ⁠— Keldar

1052.name: Griffin Witcher
1052.ability:
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Cooldown: 1
Adrenaline 3: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 3 and Lock self.
1052.ability_html: Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Cooldown: 1 Adrenaline 3: At the end of your turn, damage a random enemy unit by 3 and Lock self.
1052.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Lock: Status that disables a unit's abilities.
1052.flavor: Silver swords are great, yeah. But have you ever tried silver-plated arrowheads?

1053.name: Griffin Witcher Mentor
1053.ability:
Deploy: Draw your top unit and boost it by 1, then shuffle a card from your hand back into your deck.
Adrenaline 4: Draw your top 2 units and boost them by 1, then shuffle 2 cards from your hand back into your deck instead.
1053.ability_html: Deploy: Draw your top unit and boost it by 1, then shuffle a card from your hand back into your deck. Adrenaline 4: Draw your top 2 units and boost them by 1, then shuffle 2 cards from your hand back into your deck instead.
1053.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1053.flavor: Knowledge will keep you alive far longer than might, dear boy.

1054.name: Griffin Witcher Ranger
1054.ability:
Formation.
Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each unit on an enemy row.
Order: Transfer all boost from self to an allied unit.
1054.ability_html: Formation. Deploy: Boost self by 1 for each unit on an enemy row. Order: Transfer all boost from self to an allied unit.
1054.keyword_html: Formation: If played on the melee row, gain Zeal. If played on the ranged row, boost self by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1054.flavor: Griffin Witcher Rangers are unparalleled masters in the art of tracking and hunting, even amid the most inhospitable of environments. No matter the trail, they won’t rest until their prey is captured, or killed.

1055.name: Griffin Witcher Adept
1055.ability:
Shield.
Order: Transform an allied Witcher into a base copy of Griffin Witcher Adept.
1055.ability_html: Shield. Order: Transform an allied Witcher into a base copy of Griffin Witcher Adept.
1055.keyword_html: Shield: Status that blocks the next instance of damage dealt to a unit. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1055.flavor: At Kaer Seren, students are afforded the luxury of choice when it comes to their final Trial. They either locate and retrieve a griffin’s egg, or recite the entirety of Liber Tenebrarum verbatim. To Old Keldar’s dismay, no one has ever chosen the latter.

1056.name: Target Practice
1056.ability: Boost an allied unit by 4. If there is a Witcher on the boosted unit's row, also Spawn a Witcher Student on that row.
1056.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 4. If there is a Witcher on the boosted unit's row, also Spawn a Witcher Student on that row.
1056.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1056.flavor: Most Griffins can split an apple in two from a hundred paces. Just make sure you don’t move.

1057.name: Viy
1057.ability: Deathwish: Shuffle Viy back into your deck, then increase its base power by 3.
1057.ability_html: Deathwish: Shuffle Viy back into your deck, then increase its base power by 3.
1057.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard.
1057.flavor: What has a million legs and can eat a city whole?

1058.name: Koshchey
1058.ability:
Thrive.
Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn a Drone on this row.
Adrenaline 4: Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn an Endrega Larva on this row instead.
1058.ability_html: Thrive. Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn a Drone on this row. Adrenaline 4: Whenever this unit's Thrive is triggered, Spawn an Endrega Larva on this row instead.
1058.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1058.flavor: If I tell you koshchey is death, you'll go to the creek anyway, right?

1059.name: Dol Dhu Lokke
1059.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play a Succubus, Phooca, Chimera, or Hybrid.
Order: Move the highest-power unit to the top of your deck and Spawn a Drone on each side of this card.
1059.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play a Succubus, Phooca, Chimera, or Hybrid. Order: Move the highest-power unit to the top of your deck and Spawn a Drone on each side of this card.
1059.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1059.flavor: A monster lair unlike any other. Home to countless horrors and monstrosities. Even a witcher would think twice about setting foot near this hellhole.

1060.name: Idr
1060.ability:
Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, damage it by 1 and gain a Charge.
Order: Spawn a Drone on this row.
Charges: 0
1060.ability_html: Whenever your opponent plays a unit on their side of the battlefield, damage it by 1 and gain a Charge. Order: Spawn a Drone on this row. Charges: 0
1060.keyword_html: Charge: The number of times an Order ability can be used. Only cards with Charge: X can gain additional Charges. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game.

1061.name: Wererat
1061.ability:
Order: Spawn a number of Rats on this row equal to the amount of boost on self, then lose a point of boost for each Rat Spawned.
Cooldown: 1
Before the end of your turn, Consume the unit to the right.
1061.ability_html: Order: Spawn a number of Rats on this row equal to the amount of boost on self, then lose a point of boost for each Rat Spawned. Cooldown: 1 Before the end of your turn, Consume the unit to the right.
1061.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead.
1061.flavor: As a child, Idarran lived in the canals of Vizima. He was a natural-born genius, and at the age of five, he had already started experimenting on sewer rats.

1062.name: Succubus
1062.ability:
Deathwish: At the end of your turn, if there is another Succubus in your graveyard, Summon self from your graveyard to a random row and gain Doomed.
Adrenaline 4: Don't gain Doomed.
1062.ability_html: Deathwish: At the end of your turn, if there is another Succubus in your graveyard, Summon self from your graveyard to a random row and gain Doomed. Adrenaline 4: Don't gain Doomed.
1062.keyword_html: Deathwish: Trigger this ability when destroyed and moved from the battlefield to the graveyard. Note: Banished units are not sent to the graveyard. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.

1063.name: Phooca
1063.keyword_html: Thrive: Boost this unit by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a unit with higher power.
1063.flavor: Particularly troublesome are the larger, stronger breed—a rare kind of nekker known as phoocas. If you see one, run.

1064.name: Chimera
1064.ability:
Deploy: Consume an allied unit.
Adrenaline 5: Also boost all copies of the Consumed unit on that unit's row by 1.
1064.ability_html: Deploy: Consume an allied unit. Adrenaline 5: Also boost all copies of the Consumed unit on that unit's row by 1.
1064.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1064.flavor: At first, Cosimo combined genes of a fiend and a griffin. Then he added some traces of insectoid and wyvern to the pool, resulting in a creature far worse than the sum of its parts.

1065.name: Spontaneous Evolution
1065.ability:
Boost an allied unit by 5 and gain an additional effect based on the unit's category:
Insectoid - Spawn 3 drones on the boosted unit's row.
Beast - Boost that unit by 9 instead.
Ogroid - Spawn a Nekker on the boosted unit's row.
1065.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 5 and gain an additional effect based on the unit's category: Insectoid - Spawn 3 drones on the boosted unit's row. Beast - Boost that unit by 9 instead. Ogroid - Spawn a Nekker on the boosted unit's row.
1065.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1065.flavor: Professor Malaspina accidentally added an extra ingredient to the concoction—compound X.

1066.name: Fallen Rayla
1066.ability:
Veil.
Profit 3.
Tribute 3: Remove Poison from an allied unit, then boost self by 5.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, Poison it and remove a Counter.
When the Counter reaches 0, the Tribute becomes a Fee. 
Counter: 2
1066.ability_html: Veil. Profit 3. Tribute 3: Remove Poison from an allied unit, then boost self by 5. Whenever your opponent plays a unit, Poison it and remove a Counter. When the Counter reaches 0, the Tribute becomes a Fee. Counter: 2
1066.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
1066.flavor: Slain by the arrows of those she had hunted. Or so many thought. The Salamandra had different plans for her.

1067.name: Salamander
1067.ability:
Profit 1.
Deploy: Poison a unit. 
Tribute 9: Poison all units on the battlefield instead.
Increase the Profit by 1 for each allied Salamandra unit.
1067.ability_html: Profit 1. Deploy: Poison a unit. Tribute 9: Poison all units on the battlefield instead. Increase the Profit by 1 for each allied Salamandra unit.
1067.keyword_html: Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability.
1067.flavor: Despite their cute little faces, it's best to avoid petting them, as the salamander, when threatened, secretes a deadly toxin that boils the very skin it comes into contact with.

1068.name: Salamandra Hideout
1068.ability:
Resilience.
Deploy: Spawn and play a Failed Experiment, Salamandra Abomination, Salamandra Mage, or Salamandra Lackey.
Order: Move Poison from an allied unit to another unit.
1068.ability_html: Resilience. Deploy: Spawn and play a Failed Experiment, Salamandra Abomination, Salamandra Mage, or Salamandra Lackey. Order: Move Poison from an allied unit to another unit.
1068.keyword_html: Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it.
1068.flavor: Those who go lurking in the sewers beneath Vizima better watch out, as there are things far worse than rats hidden amid the darkness of the city’s underbelly.

1069.name: Roland Bleinheim
1069.ability: Whenever a unit gains Poison, gain 2 Coins.
1069.ability_html: Whenever a unit gains Poison, gain 2 Coins.
1069.keyword_html: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
1069.flavor: “How's my brother doing in the sewers, I wonder...” ⁠— Roland

1070.name: Gellert Bleinheim
1070.ability:
Immunity.
Profit 2.
Fee 1: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2.
Cooldown: 1
Adrenaline 6: At the end of your turn, Purify self.
1070.ability_html: Immunity. Profit 2. Fee 1: Poison an allied unit and boost it by 2. Cooldown: 1 Adrenaline 6: At the end of your turn, Purify self.
1070.keyword_html: Immunity: Status whereby this card cannot be manually targeted. Profit: Gain a specified number of Coins when this card is played. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Purify: Remove all statuses.
1070.flavor: “How's my brother doing in the woods, I wonder...” ⁠— Gellert

1071.name: Salamandra Lackey
1071.ability: Deploy: Purify an allied unit and gain 2 Coins for each status removed.
1071.ability_html: Deploy: Purify an allied unit and gain 2 Coins for each status removed.
1071.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Purify: Remove all statuses. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
1071.flavor: Lackeys are expected to perform their first five jobs for no pay, demonstrating their passion for the gig.

1072.name: Salamandra Abomination
1072.ability:
Tribute 1: Poison self.
Whenever this unit is Poisoned, boost self by 2.
Adrenaline 6: At the end of your turn, Purify self.
1072.ability_html: Tribute 1: Poison self. Whenever this unit is Poisoned, boost self by 2. Adrenaline 6: At the end of your turn, Purify self.
1072.keyword_html: Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger. Purify: Remove all statuses.
1072.flavor: Salamandra’s scientists were so preoccupied with whether they could, they never once considered if they should.

1073.name: Salamandra Mage
1073.ability:
Tribute 5: Damage 3 adjacent enemy units by 2.
Whenever you pay a Tribute ability, gain 1 Coins.
Adrenaline 5: Gain 2 Coins instead.
1073.ability_html: Tribute 5: Damage 3 adjacent enemy units by 2. Whenever you pay a Tribute ability, gain 1 Coins. Adrenaline 5: Gain 2 Coins instead.
1073.keyword_html: Tribute: On Deploy, you may choose to spend the specified amount of Coins to trigger this ability. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Adrenaline: Trigger this ability if you have specified number or fewer cards in your hand. Cards with Adrenaline are highlighted when their effect is stronger.
1073.flavor: Building a fire warms people for a day, but setting them on fire…

1074.name: Failed Experiment
1074.ability:
Deploy: Poison self.
Fee 4: Move Poison from self to another unit.
Cooldown: 3
1074.ability_html: Deploy: Poison self. Fee 4: Move Poison from self to another unit. Cooldown: 3
1074.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
1074.flavor: Even failed experiments can serve a purpose. How else would one be expected to push the boundaries of knowledge?

1075.name: Stolen Mutagens
1075.ability:
Choose a mutagen:
Red - Damage an enemy unit by 4.
Blue - Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins.
Green - Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil.
If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, also choose an additional mutagen.
1075.ability_html: Choose a mutagen: Red - Damage an enemy unit by 4. Blue - Poison an allied unit and gain 5 Coins. Green - Boost an allied unit by 4 and give it Veil. If you control at least 2 Salamandra units, also choose an additional mutagen.
1075.keyword_html: Poison: Status - if a unit receives two instances of Poison, destroy it. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses.
1075.flavor: Like organ harvesting—but far more lucrative.

1076.name: Hybrid
1076.ability:
Deploy (Melee): If a unit was destroyed during this turn, boost self by 5.
Deploy (Ranged): Consume an allied unit.
1076.ability_html: Deploy (Melee): If a unit was destroyed during this turn, boost self by 5. Deploy (Ranged): Consume an allied unit.
1076.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row. Consume: Destroy a unit and boost self by its power. If target is in the graveyard, Banish it instead.
1076.flavor: When one head just isn’t enough.

1077.name: Saber-Tooth Tiger: Stealth
1077.ability: At the start of your turn, damage all enemy units that are alone on their row by 2 and transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger.
1077.ability_html: At the start of your turn, damage all enemy units that are alone on their row by 2 and transform self into Saber-Tooth Tiger.
1077.flavor: The prized possession of a royal menagerie, until a commando of Scoia'tael assaulted the exhibition, released the beast, and set it upon its cruel masters. Since that day, it has acquired a selective taste for human flesh.

1078.name: Madoc
1078.ability:
Whenever you play a Bomb, Summon self from your deck or graveyard to random allied row.
Order: Spawn Cataclysm on the opposite row for 1 turn, then destroy self.
1078.ability_html: Whenever you play a Bomb, Summon self from your deck or graveyard to random allied row. Order: Spawn Cataclysm on the opposite row for 1 turn, then destroy self.
1078.keyword_html: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Cataclysm: At the start of the owner's turn, split 3 damage randomly between units in this row.
1078.flavor: In a flash, Madoc pulled out a leathery orb with a fuse, ignited it with a snap of his fingers, and tossed it at the feet of the caterwauling behemoth.

1079.name: Anna Henrietta
1079.ability: Deploy (Ranged): Replace your leader ability with a base copy of your opponent's leader ability.
1079.ability_html: Deploy (Ranged): Replace your leader ability with a base copy of your opponent's leader ability.
1079.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Ranged: This ability can only be used while on the ranged row.
1079.flavor: As head of state, I must judge her fairly. But she is my sister, thus my heart bleeds for her…

1080.name: Emhyr var Emreis
1080.ability:
Deploy: Play a bronze Soldier or Aristocrat from your hand, then draw a card.
Whenever your opponent plays a unit, give it Spying.
Order: Seize a 1-power enemy unit with Spying.
Devotion: At the end of your turn, refresh this card's Order.
1080.ability_html: Deploy: Play a bronze Soldier or Aristocrat from your hand, then draw a card. Whenever your opponent plays a unit, give it Spying. Order: Seize a 1-power enemy unit with Spying. Devotion: At the end of your turn, refresh this card's Order.
1080.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1080.flavor: They do not call me the Patient. Take care they do not call you the Headless.

1081.name: Crach an Craite
1081.ability:
Deploy: Give 3 Pirates or Ships in your hand 2 Armor.
Order: Damage a unit by 1.
Cooldown: 2
Whenever you play a Pirate or Ship next to Crach, it Clashes with the lowest-power enemy unit.
1081.ability_html: Deploy: Give 3 Pirates or Ships in your hand 2 Armor. Order: Damage a unit by 1. Cooldown: 2 Whenever you play a Pirate or Ship next to Crach, it Clashes with the lowest-power enemy unit.
1081.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused. Clash: Units simultanously damage each other by their power.
1081.flavor: Nilfgaardians call 'im Tirth ys Muire, the Wild Boar o' the Sea. Use 'im to scare their kiddies!

1082.name: Eist Tuirseach
1082.ability:
Veteran.
Deploy (Bloodthirst 3): Draw a card, then Discard a card.
Whenever you Discard a non-Neutral unit during your turn, Summon it from your graveyard to this row.
Counter: 2
Devotion: Also works whenever a non-Neutral unit enters your graveyard during your turn.
1082.ability_html: Veteran. Deploy (Bloodthirst 3): Draw a card, then Discard a card. Whenever you Discard a non-Neutral unit during your turn, Summon it from your graveyard to this row. Counter: 2 Devotion: Also works whenever a non-Neutral unit enters your graveyard during your turn.
1082.keyword_html: Veteran: At the start of the second and third round, increase the base power of this unit by 1. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bloodthirst: Number of damaged enemy units required to trigger this ability. Discard: Move a card from your hand to the graveyard. Note: Related abilities are not triggered when discarding manually. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played). Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1082.flavor: Eist came to Cintra to help Crach an Craite win the hand of Princess Pavetta, yet wound up winning her mother's heart for himself.

1083.name: Brouver Hoog
1083.ability:
Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for each Dwarf in your hand.
Barricade: At the end of your turn, boost all Dwarves with Armor on this row by 1, then lose 1 Armor.
1083.ability_html: Deploy: Gain 1 Armor for each Dwarf in your hand. Barricade: At the end of your turn, boost all Dwarves with Armor on this row by 1, then lose 1 Armor.
1083.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power. Barricade: Trigger this ability if the unit has armor.
1083.flavor: That doddery dolt? Ye cannae even tell if he's alive or stuffed!

1084.name: Eldain
1084.ability:
Deploy: Transform all your face-up Traps into Elven Deadeyes.
Devotion: Also transform your other artifacts.
1084.ability_html: Deploy: Transform all your face-up Traps into Elven Deadeyes. Devotion: Also transform your other artifacts.
1084.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1084.flavor: The king once dispatched an envoy to Eldain… despite my advice to the contrary. Found the envoy the next day, eyes gouged out, shaft of his white flag jammed down his throat.

1085.name: King Foltest
1085.ability:
The first time a bronze non-Neutral unit on your side of the battlefield is boosted each turn, Spawn a base copy of it at the bottom of your deck.
Devotion: Also boost the Spawned copy by 1.
At the end of your turn, boost a unit to the right by 1.
1085.ability_html: The first time a bronze non-Neutral unit on your side of the battlefield is boosted each turn, Spawn a base copy of it at the bottom of your deck. Devotion: Also boost the Spawned copy by 1. At the end of your turn, boost a unit to the right by 1.
1085.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1085.flavor: Don't need advisors and their schemes. I place my trust in my soldiers' blades.

1086.name: Queen Meve
1086.ability:
Deploy: Reduce the Timer by 1 for each adjacent unit with an Inspired ability.
Timer 3: Boost all allied units by 1 and reset the Timer.
Whenever this unit receives a boost, gain 1 Armor.
1086.ability_html: Deploy: Reduce the Timer by 1 for each adjacent unit with an Inspired ability. Timer 3: Boost all allied units by 1 and reset the Timer. Whenever this unit receives a boost, gain 1 Armor.
1086.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Timer: Before the end of your turn, lower the number by 1. When the number reaches 0, trigger the ability. Inspired: Trigger this ability if this unit's current power is higher than its base power. Armor: Protects the unit from damage. This value doesn't count towards your score and/or the unit's power.
1086.flavor: We're at war, when rulers don't strive nor choose. When rulers grasp sword and shield and ride out to defend their subjects.

1087.name: Dettlaff van der Eretein
1087.ability:
Deploy: Spawn Blood Moon on an enemy row for 2 turns. Increase the duration by 1 for each adjacent Vampire.
Order: Damage an enemy unit with Bleeding by 1.
Deathblow: Spawn an Ekimmara on this row.
Cooldown: 1
1087.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn Blood Moon on an enemy row for 2 turns. Increase the duration by 1 for each adjacent Vampire. Order: Damage an enemy unit with Bleeding by 1. Deathblow: Spawn an Ekimmara on this row. Cooldown: 1
1087.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Blood Moon: At the start of the owner's turn, give a random unit in this row Bleeding (2). If the unit is already Bleeding, damage it by 2 instead. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Deathblow: Trigger this ability if this card destroys a unit. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.
1087.flavor: He did not love like a man, but like an animal. Madly, deeply, unconditionally. Wildly.

1088.name: Unseen Elder
1088.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (4).
At the end of your turn, give Bleeding (2) to a random enemy unit without Bleeding.
Devotion: Bleeding on enemy units also triggers at the end of your turn.
1088.ability_html: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Bleeding (4). At the end of your turn, give Bleeding (2) to a random enemy unit without Bleeding. Devotion: Bleeding on enemy units also triggers at the end of your turn.
1088.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bleeding: Status that damages the unit by 1 at the end of its turn. Note: Bleeding turns can accumulate, 1 turn of Bleeding cancels out 1 turn of Vitality. Bleeding ignores armor. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards.
1088.flavor: No one, not even among the higher vampires, knows exactly how old the Unseen Elder is. They only know they should never, under any circumstances, defy his will.

1089.name: Cleaver
1089.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Spawn and play Shakedown.
Increase this card's Intimidate by 1 for each adjacent Crownsplitter.
Fee 4: Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on this row.
1089.ability_html: Intimidate. Deploy: Spawn and play Shakedown. Increase this card's Intimidate by 1 for each adjacent Crownsplitter. Fee 4: Spawn a Cleaver's Muscle on this row.
1089.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
1089.flavor: Me hogs willnae go hungry th' day thanks to ye.

1090.name: Whoreson Junior
1090.ability:
Insanity.
Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy unit by 6. Gain a Coin for each point of excess damage dealt.
Devotion: Damage an enemy unit instead.
Fee 3: Destroy an enemy unit with 3 or less power.
1090.ability_html: Insanity. Deploy: Damage a boosted enemy unit by 6. Gain a Coin for each point of excess damage dealt. Devotion: Damage an enemy unit instead. Fee 3: Destroy an enemy unit with 3 or less power.
1090.keyword_html: Insanity: If you have insufficient Coins, damage this unit by its Fee amount, ignoring its Armor, to trigger its Fee ability.\nNote: Insanity cannot be used if it would destroy the unit and works only if damage is inflicted. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Devotion: Trigger this ability if your starting deck has no neutral cards. Fee: Trigger this ability by spending the specified number of Coins.
1090.flavor: A war with Whoreson will see Novigrad's gutters run red with blood.

1091.name: Rience
1091.ability:
Deploy: Look at the top 3 units in your deck. Move 1 to your graveyard, then destroy an enemy unit with power equal to that unit's power
Order: Set the power of a unit to match the number of cards in your deck.
1091.ability_html: Deploy: Look at the top 3 units in your deck. Move 1 to your graveyard, then destroy an enemy unit with power equal to that unit's power Order: Set the power of a unit to match the number of cards in your deck.
1091.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1091.flavor: “I, Rience, taught her pain. With these hands, with these fingers. And I promised her that should you fall into my hands, princess, I would also teach you pain. With these hands, with these fingers…” - Rience

1092.name: Dead Man's Tongue
1092.ability:
Banish a card from your deck. If it was a bronze, Banish another bronze card from your deck.
Boost an allied unit by the combined provision cost of Banished cards.
1092.ability_html: Banish a card from your deck. If it was a bronze, Banish another bronze card from your deck. Boost an allied unit by the combined provision cost of Banished cards.
1092.keyword_html: Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.
1092.flavor: They say the dead tell no tales. Truth is, they speak no lies.

1093.name: Blightmaker
1093.ability: Deploy: Move a card in your deck to the top of it. If it was a Mage, Spawn The Guardian on this row. If it was a special card, Spawn and play a Cow Carcass.
1093.ability_html: Deploy: Move a card in your deck to the top of it. If it was a Mage, Spawn The Guardian on this row. If it was a special card, Spawn and play a Cow Carcass.
1093.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1093.flavor: In an attempt to manufacture a superior grapevine, the empire’s botanists stumbled upon the creation of a malignant alchemical, and thus was sown the seed of a scheme most sinister.

1094.name: Mage Assassin
1094.ability:
Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2.
When moved to the top of your deck during your turn, Summon self to a random allied row and damage a random enemy unit by 2.
1094.ability_html: Deploy: Damage an enemy unit by 2. When moved to the top of your deck during your turn, Summon self to a random allied row and damage a random enemy unit by 2.
1094.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
1094.flavor: Somewhere deep within Nilfgaard’s imperial archives is a manuscript titled “Forty-Seven Ways to Kill a Man”. It’s a surprisingly jovial read.

1095.name: Fulmar
1095.ability:
Deploy: Spawn and play Tears of Siren.
Order: Replace Rain on an enemy row with Storm of the same duration.
1095.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn and play Tears of Siren. Order: Replace Rain on an enemy row with Storm of the same duration.
1095.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Rain: At the start of the owner's turn, damage 2 random units in this row by 1. Storm: At the start of the owner's turn, damage all units on this row by 1.
1095.flavor: “Praise the Goddess for all the paths that she opens before you, and turn your greedy gaze away from those She closes in her wisdom” - Fulmar

1096.name: Bride of the Sea
1096.ability: Deploy: Play an Alchemy card from your graveyard with a provision cost 4 or less. Increase the cost by the total duration of Rain and Storm on your opponent's side.
1096.ability_html: Deploy: Play an Alchemy card from your graveyard with a provision cost 4 or less. Increase the cost by the total duration of Rain and Storm on your opponent's side.
1096.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Rain: At the start of the owner's turn, damage 2 random units in this row by 1. Storm: At the start of the owner's turn, damage all units on this row by 1.
1096.flavor: Chosen from among the descendants of Rioghan the Undying. A man whose deeds have cast a dark shadow over his kin for decades.

1097.name: Melusine Cultist
1097.ability:
Order: Spawn Rain on an enemy row for 2 turns.
At the end of your turn, if there is Rain on the opposite row, boost the unit to the right by 1. If there is Storm on the opposite row, boost adjacent units by 1 instead.
1097.ability_html: Order: Spawn Rain on an enemy row for 2 turns. At the end of your turn, if there is Rain on the opposite row, boost the unit to the right by 1. If there is Storm on the opposite row, boost adjacent units by 1 instead.
1097.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Rain: At the start of the owner's turn, damage 2 random units in this row by 1. Storm: At the start of the owner's turn, damage all units on this row by 1.
1097.flavor: But we can still eat fish, can't we?

1098.name: Tears of Siren
1098.ability: Spawn Rain on an enemy row for 2 turns, then Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row.
1098.ability_html: Spawn Rain on an enemy row for 2 turns, then Spawn a Deafening Siren on the opposite row.
1098.keyword_html: Spawn: Add a card to the game. Rain: At the start of the owner's turn, damage 2 random units in this row by 1.
1098.flavor: It is said they only cry for love lost. A pity they only love once in a lifetime…

1099.name: Francesca Findabair
1099.ability:
Veil.
Whenever you play a special card, remove one Counter.
Counter: 2
When the Counter reaches 0, Spawn and play a base copy of the last special card you played. If it is Neutral, also give it Doomed.
1099.ability_html: Veil. Whenever you play a special card, remove one Counter. Counter: 2 When the Counter reaches 0, Spawn and play a base copy of the last special card you played. If it is Neutral, also give it Doomed.
1099.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
1099.flavor: Francesca Findabair's blue elven eyes were as impenetrable and hard as glass. When he was introduced to her, the Daisy of the Valleys smiled. The smile, though incredibly beautiful, filled the witcher with terror.

1100.name: Vanadáin
1100.ability:
Deploy: Move up to 2 cards from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Add Waylay to your hand for each card moved that way.
Whenever you play Waylay, Spawn an Elven Deadeye on this row.
1100.ability_html: Deploy: Move up to 2 cards from your hand to the bottom of your deck. Add Waylay to your hand for each card moved that way. Whenever you play Waylay, Spawn an Elven Deadeye on this row.
1100.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1100.flavor: It’s better to first gag humans, then listen to what they have to say.

1101.name: Sorceress of Dol Blathanna
1101.ability: Order: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael special card with a provision cost equal to, or lower than, this card's power.
1101.ability_html: Order: Create and play a bronze Scoia'tael special card with a provision cost equal to, or lower than, this card's power.
1101.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
1101.flavor: Whilst you are mesmerized by the fishes, a different elf moves to cut your throat.

1102.name: Whisperer of Dol Blathanna
1102.ability:
Veil.
When you play a special card, Spawn a base copy of self on this row and remove a Counter.
Counter: 1
1102.ability_html: Veil. When you play a special card, Spawn a base copy of self on this row and remove a Counter. Counter: 1
1102.keyword_html: Veil: Status that prevents unit from gaining other statuses. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1102.flavor: You won't find more fertile land than in the Valley of Flowers, and with a little magic you can count on a ripe harvest up to three times a year.

1103.name: Gerhart of Aelle
1103.ability:
Patience.
Zeal. Order: Create and play a [4]-provision cost Spell.
1103.ability_html: Patience. Zeal. Order: Create and play a [4]-provision cost Spell.
1103.keyword_html: Patience: At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, increase the card's specified value by 1 for the rest of the game. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Create: Spawn one of three randomly selected cards from the specified source.
1103.flavor: Gerhart of Aelle, otherwise known as Hen Gedymdeith, was the oldest living sorcerer. That is, until his death on Thanedd Island during the coup, where his heart, feeble from inconceivable age, simply gave out among the ruckus.

1104.name: Istredd
1104.ability:
Patience.
Zeal. Order: Draw up to [1] card(s), then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck.
Whenever you draw a unit card, boost it by 1, if it's not a unit, boost self by 1 instead.
1104.ability_html: Patience. Zeal. Order: Draw up to [1] card(s), then shuffle the same number of cards back into your deck. Whenever you draw a unit card, boost it by 1, if it's not a unit, boost self by 1 instead.
1104.keyword_html: Patience: At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, increase the card's specified value by 1 for the rest of the game. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1104.flavor: Love can make one do crazy things. The loss of love, even more so.

1105.name: Casting Contest
1105.ability: Boost an allied unit by 5. If it's bronze, reset its Order ability and give it Zeal.
1105.ability_html: Boost an allied unit by 5. If it's bronze, reset its Order ability and give it Zeal.
1105.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield.
1105.flavor: Tales of Yennefer of Vengerberg have spurred many an inebriated attempt to replicate her fabled foot-casting. It never ends well.

1106.name: Ban Ard Student
1106.ability:
Patience (Melee).
Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by [0].
1106.ability_html: Patience (Melee). Order (Melee): Damage an enemy unit by [0].
1106.keyword_html: Patience: At the end of your turn, if Order is not used, increase the card's specified value by 1 for the rest of the game. Melee: This ability can only be used while on the melee row. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield.
1106.flavor: Kaedweni Intelligence considers Ban Ard a hot spot for recruitment, and expelled students⁠—of which there are many⁠—often find themselves swiftly enlisted within the secret service.

1107.name: She Who Knows
1107.ability: Sabbath: At the end of round, give Resilience to the highest base power unit on your side of the battlefield.
1107.ability_html: Sabbath: At the end of round, give Resilience to the highest base power unit on your side of the battlefield.
1107.keyword_html: Sabbath: Trigger this ability if at least one of your rows has a total of 25 or more points. Resilience: Status that allows a unit to remain on the battlefield at the end of the round, then disappears.\nNote: Boost and Armor are not carried over to the next round.
1107.flavor: She knows well what kind of clay her daughters are made of. After all, she kneaded it herself.

1108.name: Rat Catcheress
1108.ability:
Whenever this unit is damaged, reduce its base power by 1.
Sabbath: Cancel the ability above.
Whenever you play a Relict, increase this unit's base power by 1.
1108.ability_html: Whenever this unit is damaged, reduce its base power by 1. Sabbath: Cancel the ability above. Whenever you play a Relict, increase this unit's base power by 1.
1108.keyword_html: Sabbath: Trigger this ability if at least one of your rows has a total of 25 or more points.
1108.flavor: The witch grabbed the bells and started to play a lively melody that attracted small rodents and children alike.

1109.name: Gan Ceann
1109.ability: Deploy: Increase this unit's base power by 2 for each adjacent Relict.
1109.ability_html: Deploy: Increase this unit's base power by 2 for each adjacent Relict.
1109.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played.
1109.flavor: A head in the hands is worth two on the neck.

1110.name: Witch Apprentice
1110.ability: Sabbath: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2.
1110.ability_html: Sabbath: At the end of your turn, boost self by 2.
1110.keyword_html: Sabbath: Trigger this ability if at least one of your rows has a total of 25 or more points.
1110.flavor: Mistress said I would have to toss it on the spit after I finish my studies, but she was just kidding. Right...?

1111.name: The Witchfinder
1111.ability:
Deploy: Spawn 3 Syndicate Crowns on this row.
At the end of your turn, if no enemy unit has a Bounty, place a Bounty on the highest-power enemy unit.
1111.ability_html: Deploy: Spawn 3 Syndicate Crowns on this row. At the end of your turn, if no enemy unit has a Bounty, place a Bounty on the highest-power enemy unit.
1111.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
1111.flavor: Woe to all those who find themselves on the wrong side of Octavia Hale, the self-proclaimed world-renowned finder⁠—and punisher⁠—of witches, warlocks, and were-things.

1112.name: Syndicate Crown
1112.ability:
Doomed.
Zeal. Order: Gain 1 Coin and Banish self.
1112.ability_html: Doomed. Zeal. Order: Gain 1 Coin and Banish self.
1112.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield. Zeal: An Order ability can be used on the same turn the card is placed on the battlefield. Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round. Banish: Remove from the game. Note: Does not count as being destroyed.

1113.name: Fabian Hale
1113.ability:
Intimidate.
Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. If there already was an enemy unit with a Bounty, gain Coins equal to its base power.
1113.ability_html: Intimidate. Deploy: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit. If there already was an enemy unit with a Bounty, gain Coins equal to its base power.
1113.keyword_html: Intimidate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a Crime card. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time. Coin: The Novigradian underworld's currency of choice for paying Fees and Tributes. You may possess a maximum of 9 Coins. Your Coin-count is reduced by half (rounded down) when carried over into the next round.
1113.flavor: Fabian takes great pride in his work, with each “victory” etched upon his skin as a permanent reminder of memories most pleasant.

1114.name: Hysteria
1114.ability: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit and damage it by 3. If it already has a Bounty, damage by 6 instead.
1114.ability_html: Place a Bounty on an enemy unit and damage it by 3. If it already has a Bounty, damage by 6 instead.
1114.keyword_html: Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
1114.flavor: Somebody’s poisoned the waterhole! With innards!

1115.name: Vigilantes
1115.ability: Whenever a Bounty is placed on an enemy unit, damage it by 2.
1115.ability_html: Whenever a Bounty is placed on an enemy unit, damage it by 2.
1115.keyword_html: Bounty: When a unit with this status is destroyed or banished, opponent gains coins equal to its base power. There can be only one unit with Bounty status on each side of the board at given time.
1115.flavor: The alderman’s wife worked all night on these here costumes⁠—you should be damned grateful, you swines!

1116.name: Teleportation
1116.ability: Reset an allied unit's power. If it's a bronze unit, replay it instead.
1116.ability_html: Reset an allied unit's power. If it's a bronze unit, replay it instead.
1116.flavor: There was a flash and he stopped seeing, hearing or feeling anything⁠—apart from cold. Cold was the only thing felt inside the black nothingness, amid silence, amorphousness and timelessness, because the teleport dulled and extinguished all other senses.

1117.name: Megascope
1117.ability:
Deploy: Choose a bronze allied unit.
Timer 2: Spawn a base copy of chosen unit to the right of Megascope.
1117.ability_html: Deploy: Choose a bronze allied unit. Timer 2: Spawn a base copy of chosen unit to the right of Megascope.
1117.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Timer: Before the end of your turn, lower the number by 1. When the number reaches 0, trigger the ability. Spawn: Add a card to the game.
1117.flavor: In order to communicate at a distance, one must construct a magical artefact⁠—a megascope⁠—using magic.

1118.name: Left Fucking Flank
1118.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
1118.flavor: I's a war veteran! Spare me a crown?

1119.name: Right Fucking Flank
1119.keyword_html: Doomed: Status that removes the card from the game after it leaves the battlefield.
1119.flavor: I's a war veteran! Spare me a crown?

1120.name: Artaud Terranova
1120.ability:
Assimilate.
Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of any non-Disloyal unit you gave Spying to during this game, excluding self.
1120.ability_html: Assimilate. Deploy: Spawn and play a base copy of any non-Disloyal unit you gave Spying to during this game, excluding self.
1120.keyword_html: Assimilate: Boost self by 1 or the specified amount whenever you play a card that is not from your starting deck. Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spawn: Add a card to the game. Disloyal: This card is played on the opposite side of the battlefield, then gains Spying. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.

1121.name: Sunset Wanderers
1121.ability:
This card starts in the leftmost position of your hand.
At the start of your turn, while in hand, move self one position to the right, then boost self by 1.
At the end of your turn, if you haven't passed and there are no cards to the right of this card, Summon self from your hand to a random allied row, then draw a card.
1121.ability_html: This card starts in the leftmost position of your hand. At the start of your turn, while in hand, move self one position to the right, then boost self by 1. At the end of your turn, if you haven't passed and there are no cards to the right of this card, Summon self from your hand to a random allied row, then draw a card.
1121.keyword_html: Summon: Move automatically to the battlefield (not considered played).
1121.flavor: It seemed like Dandelion meant to journey with the witcher, even to the edge of the world.

1122.name: Fercart
1122.ability:
Deploy: Play a special card from your hand, then draw a card.
Whenever you play a special card, give Spying to a random non-Spying enemy unit.
1122.ability_html: Deploy: Play a special card from your hand, then draw a card. Whenever you play a special card, give Spying to a random non-Spying enemy unit.
1122.keyword_html: Deploy: Trigger this ability when played. Spying: Status with no additional effect. Can be used by other cards and abilities.
1122.flavor: Pawns will never know of the unseen hands, maneuvering them toward certain doom.

1123.name: Master of Puppets
1123.ability:
Order: Seize a bronze enemy unit, then move self to the opposite row.
Cooldown: 2
1123.ability_html: Order: Seize a bronze enemy unit, then move self to the opposite row. Cooldown: 2
1123.keyword_html: Order: An ability triggered manually by the player. Cards with Order cannot be used for 1 turn after being placed on the battlefield. Seize: Move an enemy unit to the opposite row and give it Spying. If it already had Spying, remove Spying instead. Cooldown: The number of turns before an Order or Fee ability can be reused.

1124.name: Thanedd Turncoat
1124.ability:
Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying.
Order (Conspiracy): Damage an enemy unit by 1.
Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, reduce the Cooldown by 1.
Cooldown: 2
1124.ability_html: Deploy: Give an enemy unit Spying. Order (Conspiracy): Damage an enemy unit by 1. Whenever an enemy unit gains Spying, reduce the Cooldown by 1. Cooldown: 2
